excerpts: Perbacco is a nice and fancy spot for Italian in FiDi.
perbacco.author: Dianna H.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is a nice and fancy spot for Italian in FiDi. Would be great for business lunches/dinners or dates (but maybe not the first one XP).

I picked this spot for a team lunch and was able to make the reservation for our party of 8 for a noon lunch on Wed just the day before. I appreciated their flexibility as I was scrambling to find a last minute lunch spot to accommodate our larger group. Note that for larger groups, they do ask for a credit card number when you make the reservation.

Note: don't get this restaurant confused with its sister restaurant Barbacco, which is more casual and comes at a slightly lower price point. Even though I was trying to avoid making this mistake, I still somehow made reservations at Barbacco first. Whoops.

They start out the meal with small thin breadsticks, which I've never seen before. These were just okay, but I wasn't a huge fan of the long and thin shape. Also I thought they were slightly dry, even with the provided sauce.

Luckily they followed this up with some delicious bread. I'm not sure exactly what type of bread it was (our guess was focaccia), but it was very light and soft. When they came around to offer seconds of this bread, I went for it with no doubt or hesitation.

I asked our server about their most popular dishes, and according to her, the pappardelle ($24) is the most popular dish here. It comes with slow cooked short rib ragu, young onion, and horseradish sprinkled on top. It came served piping hot, and while I didn't like the wasabi flavors on top, it was otherwise a very solid and filling dish. The pappardelle was thin and didn't stick to each other, which made it easy to eat.

For dessert, we shared two orders of the amaretti panna cotta ($11), which is served with roasted roasted peach preserve, almonds, maple caramel, and peach sorbetto. It was light and creamy and provided the perfect light and sweet ending to a heavy carb meal.

excerpts:
And with the recent influx of deliciously affordable pasta shops in the city, Perbacco just kept getting pushed further and further down the list.

But, having the opportunity to nab a company-sponsored meal several weeks back, Perbacco popped back up on my radar, making it the first time I took a proper look at their menu: to my surprise, their pastas averaged $20, like many other restaurants here, but with an additional choice between "smaller" and larger portions.

And while they still don't topple my other picks in the city, there's definitely a time and place (and mood) for the style of pasta here, so I'm absolutely adding Perbacco into the rotation.
perbacco.author: Johnny W.
perbacco.review:
*** In Short ***

Surprisingly affordable pasta that still holds up well against the upstarts.

*** In Depth ***

While I frequented Barbacco in my early years, I never got around to trying their pricier sister restaurant, always assuming it was outside my "casual" fancy eats budget. And with the recent influx of deliciously affordable pasta shops in the city, Perbacco just kept getting pushed further and further down the list.

But, having the opportunity to nab a company-sponsored meal several weeks back, Perbacco popped back up on my radar, making it the first time I took a proper look at their menu: to my surprise, their pastas averaged $20, like many other restaurants here, but with an additional choice between "smaller" and larger portions.

The other surprise came when we dug into the actual food: unlike most restaurants here, their pasta is surprisingly light. Not bland, mind you, but lighter and more flavorful than you'd expect from pasta served up in America, which often tend to be heavy-handed with butter, cream, and other seasonings. The highlights of the night were the tajarin and agnolotti, both of which I'd highly recommend.

And while they still don't topple my other picks in the city, there's definitely a time and place (and mood) for the style of pasta here, so I'm absolutely adding Perbacco into the rotation.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Spacious restaurant with plenty of accessible seating options.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.

excerpts: Third time at Perbacco and it never disappoints.
The best part of Perbacco is definitely the desserts.
We got the dark chocolate bonet along with the vanilla bean panna cotta.
perbacco.author: Karanveer M.
perbacco.review:
Third time at Perbacco and it never disappoints. 

For starters, we ordered the roasted octopus, the black truffle burrata cheese, and the brown butter roasted carrots. It was more than we should order for two people. If I had to pick, I'd get the octopus and the carrots, since the burrata cheese is good, but not extraordinary in any way (the octopus is always great and I order it every time!) 

For the pastas, we ordered the agnolotti and the tajarin. Initially, they had accidentally served us the agnolotti with short rib instead of the one on the menu (filled with roasted meats and vegetables). We hadn't even noticed the error, but the quickly brought us the correct pasta and told us to keep the original as well since we had started eating it. 5/5 for handling the situation very gracefully and quickly without us even noticing. (Servers are well trained for details in general- every time I'd use the restroom, my napkin would be neatly folded when I'd come back- something many more high-end restaurants in SF still need to do).

We liked both the agnolottis more than the tajarin. I like thin tagliatelle but I don't think the veal and the sauce went very well with it. 

The agnolotti filled with roasted meats and vegetables was definitely our favorite pasta. 

The best part of Perbacco is definitely the desserts. We got the dark chocolate bonet along with the vanilla bean panna cotta. I can't compare the two since they're both amazing. 

The vanilla cream, the brownies and the berries help enhance every bite of the bonet, which would have been amazing on its own. My usual style is to take a little bit of the vanilla cream and the brownie with a decent chunk of chocolate bonet to have an explosion of happy tastes in your mouth. I'm already hungry writing this review now. 

The vanilla bean panna cotta is also delicious and works really well with the strawberry-rhubarb preserve and the lime sorbetto, which fills your mouth with a light, refreshing taste after the main courses. 

We were there for four hours and enjoyed it thoroughly. Will come back for a fourth time.

excerpts: This was my first time at Perbacco and it won't be my last.
Service was great--our server was friendly and attentive and more than happy to answer questions or offer wine suggestions.
Overall, I had a great meal at Perbacco and despite the disappointing dessert, I am looking forward to returning.
perbacco.author: Cindy T.
perbacco.review:
This was my first time at Perbacco and it won't be my last. Service was great--our server was friendly and attentive and more than happy to answer questions or offer wine suggestions. All other staff that I encountered were also very friendly and welcoming as well. 

Like everyone, I came for dinner and ordered the pappardelle and it did not disappoint. Yummy ribbons of fresh pasta layered with short rib ragu was lighter in flavor than I expected but was delicious nonetheless. I had a bite of my friend's tajarin pasta and as a mushroom lover, I will definitely order this the next time I'm here. 

The only thing that I did not enjoy was dessert. The roasted fig dessert with seasonal berries with a side of basil gelato was very disappointing. The berry juice was drizzled on what tasted like pieces of stale/dry bread. This was not easy to eat or appetizing and I'm surprised this even made it on the menu. The roasted figs were chewy and distantly resembled the fresh figs I was imagining when I ordered this dessert. Gelato and other desserts my friends ordered for themselves were really delicious however, so I'm not sure what happened with mine. Overall, I had a great meal at Perbacco and despite the disappointing dessert, I am looking forward to returning.

excerpts: My friend was so surprised and we are very thankful for what Perbacco did for us.
perbacco.author: Xuaner Z.
perbacco.review:
I came here to meet an old friend. She had a birthday earlier this month and I want to make up for it during this dinner. I asked them to put something special on the dessert we ordered, and they did! They gave us the dirty cookie as complementary to our dessert and wrote happy birthday on the plate! My friend was so surprised and we are very thankful for what Perbacco did for us.

I had the squid ink companelle Nere, which I also enjoyed a lot. The sauce was so good!

excerpts: The accounting of my holiday season binge eating adventures cannot be complete without a review of Perbacco.
I cannot believe that I haven't written a review yet!
This is a go-to date night spot because of how wonderful it is--coupled with the relative ease getting a seat without a reservation if dining after 7:30pm most nights.
Vibrant and bustling, Perbacco is always a solid bet for excellent Italian food.
You can rely on them to have the highest quality ingredients, perfectly balanced flavors, and the most delightful homemade pasta outside of an Italian mother's kitchen.
I also rarely comment on the wine lists, but Perbacco has an approachable and unique selection of wines.
Service is also excellent at Perbacco.
The staff is highly trained and knowledgeable.

While I'd have to go back into the archives of my brain to recount all the specific dishes I have had for you, let me assure you that as a Bay Area native who has recently toured Italy for almost a month, Perbacco has Italian food that was better than a lot of places I tried in Italy.
Most recently, I had a squid ink pasta with octopus ragu and fresh seafood.
It was to die for.
Husband Bear isn't as pasta obsessed as I am, so he often gets protein centered dishes at Perbacco.
Overall, you can't go wrong at Perbacco!
perbacco.author: Susan C.
perbacco.review:
Bring on the pasta! The accounting of my holiday season binge eating adventures cannot be complete without a review of Perbacco.  I cannot believe that I haven't written a review yet! This is a go-to date night spot because of how wonderful it is--coupled with the relative ease getting a seat without a reservation if dining after 7:30pm most nights.  If not, you can most likely get into Barbacco next door--again, with relative ease after 7:00pm-7:30pm.

Vibrant and bustling, Perbacco is always a solid bet for excellent Italian food.  You can rely on them to have the highest quality ingredients, perfectly balanced flavors, and the most delightful homemade pasta outside of an Italian mother's kitchen. I also rarely comment on the wine lists, but Perbacco has an approachable and unique selection of wines.  I find ordering wine here to be extra fun.

Service is also excellent at Perbacco.  The staff is highly trained and knowledgeable.  They are also very kind, friendly, and expert multi-taskers.

While I'd have to go back into the archives of my brain to recount all the specific dishes I have had for you, let me assure you that as a Bay Area native who has recently toured Italy for almost a month, Perbacco has Italian food that was better than a lot of places I tried in Italy.  Most recently, I had a squid ink pasta with octopus ragu and fresh seafood.  It was to die for.  Husband Bear isn't as pasta obsessed as I am, so he often gets protein centered dishes at Perbacco.  They are always excellent as well!

Overall, you can't go wrong at Perbacco!

excerpts: Perbacco is located on California Street in the Financial District area of San Francisco.
It's not hard to find.
It's in between Tadich Grill and Barbacco.
(Barbacco is owned by the same restaurant group.
Also Italian fare.)
There's plenty of parking at the Embarcadero Center parking garage or you can use their Valet parking at the front.
Perbacco is on the high end spectrum of Italian cuisine.
I believe their other Italian restaurant next door (Barbacco) is more on the affordable level of dining.
The interior decor does match the grander level that I expected.
There's a bar area by the front hostess for drinks and snacks.
(I believe that they have a pretty good Happy Hour during the weekday.)
The downstairs is cozy with many tables and a half open kitchen.
They also have an upstairs dining area for a more intimate atmosphere.
Our server was friendly and helpful.
I knew the dishes I wanted
so I ordered right away.
In addition to the dishes we ordered, we were also given a couple of complimentary items which was appreciated.
A lot of Italian restaurants don't offer complimentary bread anymore so that was a nice touch.
Overall, this was a good place to go for higher quality Italian cuisine, but nothing really stood out to me out of the dishes we ordered.
I would go again if I was in this area and craving Italian.
perbacco.author: Julie W.
perbacco.review:
I wanted some carbs and only some good Italian pasta could satisfy me. This restaurant was on my list to try in the city for some time now, so I went in happily during their dinner service. 

Perbacco is located on California Street in the Financial District area of San Francisco. It's not hard to find. It's in between Tadich Grill and Barbacco. (Barbacco is owned by the same restaurant group. Also Italian fare.) There's plenty of parking at the Embarcadero Center parking garage or you can use their Valet parking at the front. Street parking is always an option too. 

Perbacco is on the high end spectrum of Italian cuisine. I believe their other Italian restaurant next door (Barbacco) is more on the affordable level of dining. The interior decor does match the grander level that I expected. There's a bar area by the front hostess for drinks and snacks. (I believe that they have a pretty good Happy Hour during the weekday.) The downstairs is cozy with many tables and a half open kitchen. They also have an upstairs dining area for a more intimate atmosphere. Our server was friendly and helpful. I knew the dishes I wanted so I ordered right away. In addition to the dishes we ordered, we were also given a couple of complimentary items which was appreciated. A lot of Italian restaurants don't offer complimentary bread anymore so that was a nice touch. Overall, this was a good place to go for higher quality Italian cuisine, but nothing really stood out to me out of the dishes we ordered. I would go again if I was in this area and craving Italian. I would probably try Barbacco next door also since I haven't been yet. 

Piastra Roasted Octopus : This was good. Not too chewy. The veal tongue was ok. The flavor was a bit bland though. 

Pappardelle : This was good. The pasta was al denté. The goat ragu tasted a bit too gamey for me. I'd probably try the Tajarin next time. 

Halibut "Alla Piastra" : This was good. I liked the flavor of the black olive aioli. The halibut was cooked nicely. The corona beans were really tasty and I usually don't eat beans.

excerpts: Perbacco is in downtown SF, so walking/public transportation is your best bet.
perbacco.author: Sophia L.
perbacco.review:
TL;DR Great service and some pretty good pasta

I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. The food was great, the service was great, the company was great! We got a bunch of dishes, but the duck pasta was the best! All pasta is made fresh in house. They also have a large wine menu. Helen, our server was funny and awesome + gave us desserts on the house. We had the ugly cookies, but those ugly cookies were yummy and sweet!

Perbacco is in downtown SF, so walking/public transportation is your best bet.

We took a stroll down to Perbacco.
All is well.

perbacco.review:
Ahhhh, Perbacco, how I love thee....thank you for opening on a Sunday. Just a quick update with some photos. 

We had an early Christmas Eve meal (2:00) and wanted a little something in the evening. Our hotel was a zoo. What had started out as a nice quiet Christmas Eve when we checked in at 11:00am, quickly turned to chaos by mid afternoon.  Not a seat nor beverage were to be had. 

We took a stroll down to Perbacco. All is well.

excerpts: so I was excited to try Perbacco.
I enjoy my meals at Barbacco a lot more so will most likely visit that restaurant again over Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Michelle T.
perbacco.review:
This is the more upscale version of the sister restaurant, Barbacco which is a few stores down. I've been to Barbacco a few times and really enjoyed everything I've tried so I was excited to try Perbacco. 

I ordered the parapadelle and brussel sprouts. The flavors in the parapdelle dish was good but the pasta was too soft and thin. So thin that I felt like I was bitting into a piece of paper. The brussel sprouts was good - the capers gave it a good kick but Barbacco makes it better (probably due to the duck fat it's cooked in). 

My co-worker ordered the sole and that looked really good and he cleaned his plate up really well. 

I enjoy my meals at Barbacco a lot more so will most likely visit that restaurant again over Perbacco.

excerpts: I highly recommend Perbacco to everyone to enjoy Staffan's creations and fresh top of the line produce, fish and meat.
perbacco.author: Christina P.
perbacco.review:
I actually went there for an Italian Passover dinner which was absolutely delicious!
Chef Staffan Terje collaborated with Chef Joyce Goldstein for an amazing, TRULY AMAZING feast.
Going into this I was skeptical, as I'm not Jewish and not familiar with the cuisine.
Joyce Goldstein, whom I had the pleasure of meeting while I was there, and who also signed a copy of her wonderful cookbook while I was there, outdid herself on this outstanding dining experience.
And of course, the charming and debonair owner Umberto Gibin visited our table and made sure we were pleased and satisfied.
I highly recommend Perbacco to everyone to enjoy Staffan's creations and fresh top of the line produce, fish and meat.

excerpts: Perbacco was close to where we were staying during our last quick trip to San Francisco, so we decided to make reservations for dinner.
There are a lot of great places to eat in San Francisco
and I'm glad we found Perbacco!
perbacco.author: Miko S.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco was close to where we were staying during our last quick trip to San Francisco, so we decided to make reservations for dinner. There are a lot of great places to eat in San Francisco and I'm glad we found Perbacco!

The ambiance and food are on point. I had the pappardelle pasta with short rib ragu, and my husband had the rigatoni with duck. On the side, a roasted butternut squash. 

Everything was delicious. The pastas were good, and both of the sauces were meaty and hearty. Definitely a heavy meal so go hungry!

I'd definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great dinner in the city!

excerpts: Had a couple of cocktails: Financial Policy and Perbacco.
perbacco.author: P S.
perbacco.review:
Dinner for 2.  Nice upscale restaurant.  Had a couple of cocktails: Financial Policy and Perbacco.  Solid! 

Ordered still water, was served sparkling and charged $9.50.  Removing 1 star. 

Ordered a Shrimp and asparagus appetizer.  It was awesome.  Tried the Tajarin, and the risotto.  Risotto not recommended bland and saltless.  Removing 1 star.  

Couple of glasses of red wine recommended by the server.  Ok, bit dry.  Ended with Panna Cota - no qualms.

excerpts: I couldn't be any happier with choosing Perbacco to celebrate a special birthday.
We've dined many times at the more casual Barbacco, and will add Perbacco to our favorite SF spots to dine.
perbacco.author: Karrot L.
perbacco.review:
I couldn't be any happier with choosing Perbacco to celebrate a special birthday. After considering several other restaurants, I choose to hold a dinner party for twelve close friends and family. 

- Making the reservation was smooth and responsive to questions
- Food was delicious. We choose several appetizers and pastas to share, family-style for the first and second courses. And for the entrees, each person selected their own dish.  Especially enjoyed were the piastra roasted octopus, raviora, risotto, sea bass, dry aged liberty farm dusk breast, and the pork.
- For dessert, we had "ugly but good" piemontese hazelnut cookies and burnt caramel gelato. All shared since we were stuffed already.
- Service provided by Annalisa and team was superb. 

My guests were saying how much they enjoyed the evening during the event, and were doing so even days afterward.  

We've dined many times at the more casual Barbacco, and will add Perbacco to our favorite SF spots to dine.

They even took the time to write happy anniversary on the plate.
Definitely choose Perbacco for a great date night!

perbacco.review: I came here once and ordered the Langaroli, and I haven't stopped dreaming about it since. I never knew other kinds of stuffed pastas besides ravioli even existed until now! I may just have to come back and try every pasta on the menu...

excerpts: I have been Perbacco for happy hours and dinner and have enjoyed it on most occasions!
I have tried a lot of their appetizers and personally think the Salumi platter is only good for big groups, if you aren't in a big group I suggest the fritto misto (basically a calamari
but with hella vegetables breaded).
Perbacco has such a great cleanly/modern interior, yet it isn't too loud like other Fi Di joints.

The servers are really nice and they are very knowledgable about the cocktails!I highly suggest getting a drink or two and trying their dinner service, but if you can't there's also Barbacco next door!
perbacco.author: Eric Joseph D.
perbacco.review:
I have been Perbacco for happy hours and dinner and have enjoyed it on most occasions! I have tried a lot of their appetizers and personally think the Salumi platter is only good for big groups, if you aren't in a big group I suggest the fritto misto (basically a calamari but with hella vegetables breaded). The rest of the appetizers seem more like sides or are priced more like main courses! 

Last time I was here, I loved the Short rib ragu last time, but it wasn't there any more as the menu changes seasonly - but they always have a few short rib dishes. Here's what I tried this time (only short rib dishes): 
-Pan Seered Beef Loin and Braised Short Rib: Short rib was an after thought, but beef loin was very flavorful.  
-Plin Al Brasato (short rib pasta): If you like short rib, I would order this pasta if you like your pasta filled with a different kind of protein. Short rib with pasta is a very interesting combo, but the soft with the slightly meaty texture is a great pairing!

When it comes to their COCKTAILS, I will divide it between these categories ($12 a piece):
The STRONG/LETS GET TURNT DRINKS: 
-Nord & Sud: Kind of like an old fashioned, but heavy on bitters. Good for your money. 
-Hemmingwaywish: RUM RUM AND RUM. Oh baby, you'll light a fire under your ass (in a good way) with this one. 

A weekday drink (get you through the week, but not too wastey): 
-Midnight Dream - tequila and chartreuse is a perfect strong yet sweet combo! (Personal fave)
-Strega Chinita - vermouth and applejack - strong after taste, but great aroma! 

Biatch drinks yet yummy: 
-Perbacco - Um where is the alcohol in this? I love hangar vodka, but honestly couldn't tell! 
-Don't Forget the Flower - basically a sangria. A big portion too. 
-Strawberry Fields - Seriously can sip a whole pitcher of this. So refreshing and not too strong! The rhubarb has a great hint to it! 

Verdict: Perbacco has such a great cleanly/modern interior, yet it isn't too loud like other Fi Di joints. The servers are really nice and they are very knowledgable about the cocktails!I highly suggest getting a drink or two and trying their dinner service, but if you can't there's also Barbacco next door!

excerpts: I had an amazing experience at Perbacco.
It's been hyped up for me (and I've been to its sister restaurant Barbacco), but it totally lived up to expectations.
I was with a group of six and everyone enjoyed the food and service tremendously.

We had a couple of appetizers between us, including the octopus, which was perfectly cooked (i.e. not rubbery at all); the burrata, which was perfectly creamy and paired with delightful asparagus; and a beet salad, which was tasty.
perbacco.author: Megan B.
perbacco.review: I had an amazing experience at Perbacco. It's been hyped up for me (and I've been to its sister restaurant Barbacco), but it totally lived up to expectations. I was with a group of six and everyone enjoyed the food and service tremendously. We had a couple of appetizers between us, including the octopus, which was perfectly cooked (i.e. not rubbery at all); the burrata, which was perfectly creamy and paired with delightful asparagus; and a beet salad, which was tasty. To drink, I started with the Aloe and Goodbye cocktail, an unusual combination that felt like a risky order, but turned out to be nicely refreshing. And for my main, I split the Raviora and the Quail with my SO - the raviora is a MUST. Meyer lemon + ricotta cheese and mint is an incredible combination. The quail is no slouch either, with a crispy exterior, delicate interior, and perfectly paired mushrooms on the side. Suffice it to say, I will be back.

excerpts: My husband and I had our post SF City Hall Wedding lunch at Perbacco.
We had 17 guests and reserved the Barolo Room.
We were very happy with the food and service we received and would not have changed anything!
Reserving the room through the manager was very easy and they were clear with the menu and  costs.
Our waitress and other wait staff were all very friendly and attentive to our party.
Our food was also great!
Definitely recommend Perbacco for a large party or if you have guests not into ethnic food
perbacco.author: Rachael F.
perbacco.review:
My husband and I had our post SF City Hall Wedding lunch at Perbacco. We had 17 guests and reserved the Barolo Room. We were very happy with the food and service we received and would not have changed anything! 
Reserving the room through the manager was very easy and they were clear with the menu and  costs. Our waitress and other wait staff were all very friendly and attentive to our party. Our food was also great! We offered:

- Burrata Cheese (the appetizer, this was a delicious beet salad filled with rich cheese)
- Agnolotti del plin (so rich and great flavors, I am not a big pasta person but really enjoyed this dish)
- Fish of the day (sole, generous portion served with a beautiful sauce)
- Gnocchi ( I did not try this but other guests loved it)

Definitely recommend Perbacco for a large party or if you have guests not into ethnic food :)

excerpts: I visited Perbacco when a work event was scheduled here.
The restaurant has a nice ambiance.
perbacco.author: Jen W.
perbacco.review:
I visited Perbacco when a work event was scheduled here.  The restaurant has a nice ambiance.  Parking is terrible in the area so the restaurant does offer valet at a price.  

Service was on point and extremely attentive.  As for food, I started off with the little gem lettuce salad.  Nothing spectacular but I do love anchovies on my greens.

For the pasta dish, I tried the raviora.  This was absolutely delish.  The pasta was filled with butternut squash and topped with fried sage.  All the pasta dishes are made in house which is always such a treat!  

For the main course, I had the short ribs.  Super tender...definitely lots of time and care went into this dish although the flavors were a little bland to me.  

Wine selection was fantastic.  I'd revisit this spot again for the pasta.

excerpts: I don't know what happened with Perbacco over the years
but I had such a disappointing experience there
last night it saddens me to reflect on it.
Suggested Perbacco since it was close to the office we were working out of.
Booking for a table of 12 was more of a headache than we thought it would be which already left a bad taste in our mouths.

First they were pushy about us booking the private room; when we requested the main dining room they made it seem like it would be a huge ordeal...finally the manager relented and said we could have a 6pm reservation but asked us to come 15 min early, then at 6pm on the dot started calling for status updates (we arrived at 6:02pm).
I'm sorry
perbacco.author: Jen E.
perbacco.review:
I don't know what happened with Perbacco over the years but I had such a disappointing experience there last night it saddens me to reflect on it. It was also embarrassing, as my colleagues from SoCal had relied on me to select a spot for our work dinner as the one who has lived in SF.

Suggested Perbacco since it was close to the office we were working out of. Booking for a table of 12 was more of a headache than we thought it would be which already left a bad taste in our mouths. First they were pushy about us booking the private room; when we requested the main dining room they made it seem like it would be a huge ordeal...finally the manager relented and said we could have a 6pm reservation but asked us to come 15 min early, then at 6pm on the dot started calling for status updates (we arrived at 6:02pm). I'm sorry, it's Wednesday, early, and you are not the hottest restaurant in SF, you just happened to be convenient location-wise.

The meal was decent, not amazing by any means given the plethora of incredible Italian places in the SF area (desserts were probably the highlight). Reasonably-priced when all was said and done (for the large group that we were). But the service...it wasn't horrible it was just straight BIZARRE.

Felt amateur for what you'd expect. Super disjointed...our server didn't seem to be able to multi-task. She would literally recoil as a sommelier was pouring our wine, as if she couldn't continue rattling off her spiel while we were being poured ("Maybe it's an internal house rule?" we wondered.) I was offered a taste by someone else from a bottle I ordered- every other glass was filled but he didn't finish pouring mine after the taste so I had to chase someone down to finish. Several clients we were entertaining had empty glasses and I had to flag someone down to get our server to offer another round. (In a corporate dinner like that, should be easy money just to keep those drinks flowing). When our server caught wind of our anxiousness, was passive aggressive to me with her disdain: "Is there ANYTHING else I can get you? Are you sure?" smiling through gritted teeth then continuously refilled my glass of wine (2 refills within 5 minutes) even though I was slowly sipping.

Afterwards I felt everyone was underwhelmed and just not blown away by any means by the ambiance, the service, the food. 2 stars at best. (Barbacco has a better vibe. Then again that was years ago so who knows.)

excerpts: If you're looking for something more casual, go next door to Barbacco, Perbacco's sister restaurant.
perbacco.author: Mike O.
perbacco.review:
Came in here for lunch yesterday with a few coworkers and my bosses.
We were seated immediately in the upstairs section, but the restaurant was actually pretty packed.
We started off with the Pesce Crudo and Fritto Misto for appetizers.
I'm not a fan of cucumber or radish, but I was able to eat the Pesce Crudo without any issues, it was good, but I would prefer a tuna tartar.
The Fritto Misto is pretty much battered deep fried veggies and a few shrimp with a side of mayo. It's actually pretty simple, but made for a good appetizer. It didn't seem like many of us like olives, but I love them!
For my main, I got the Piastra Roasted Chicken Breast, which I have ordered once before. I guess I wasn't feeling adventurous yesterday, but I ordered this dish because I had a good experience with it a few years ago.
My coworkers and bosses got the Subrich (meatballs), and Semolina Dusted Petrale Sole. 
I didn't get a taste of their meals, but they seemed to enjoy it.
As for my chicken, it was cooked perfectly! It had the right amount of crisp on the skin, it wasn't dry, and the green garlic-herb jus made a perfect light sauce. Portions of my chicken I felt was a bit small, but with the appetizers I felt I had the right amount of food.
We went to order a few desserts for the table; the Malted Dark Chocolate Ganache and the Stonefruit Gelato.
Although I liked the texture of the chocolate, I don't think I would get it again. The big piece in the center looked more like a milk chocolate (which is what I prefer), but had the taste of dark chocolate. Sorry, I'm just not a dark chocolate person.
The Stonefruit Gelato was absolutely amazing! It's extremely hard for me to describe this one as I haven't had a gelato like this before. You'll just have to give it a try!
Overall service wasn't terrible, but there was a lot of waiting in between orders. We intended to finish within an 1hr15mins, but from entering the door and leaving, it took about 1hr45mins.
This probably isn't somewhere I would come by myself, but it makes for a nice business lunch/dinner spot, or somewhere to take a date.
If you're looking for something more casual, go next door to Barbacco, Perbacco's sister restaurant.

excerpts: Perbacco is highly recommended.
We'll be back.
perbacco.author: Steve L.
perbacco.review:
A fine experience at yet another excellent San Francisco restaurant. Service began with breadsticks and a small ramekin filled with a slightly spicy pesto for dipping. We then ordered a carafe of a house-recommended medium-bodied red wine from Umbria. Unfortunately, we don't recall the varietal or the name, as we arrived having already quaffed a few and were in the "wine-yes" phase, but it was tasty. 

For dinner we started with Mozzarella di Bufala - small half-rounds of characteristically mild, locally-produced cheese served with strawberries. Our main courses were slices of duck breast tender enough to cut with a butter knife and a unique dish called langaroli - thick pasta noodles folded and stuffed with braised short ribs and black truffle butter. It was all delicious. 

We saved room for dessert, allegedly. We ordered burnt caramel gelato and something called Duo Di Bonet - white and milk chocolate with meringue and roasted cherries. No complaints. 

We'd like to make brief shout-out to the service staff. We were initially seated next to a very loud and sloppy four-top; what seemed like married men and women but not to each other. Interesting. But the noise level was the problem. So the floor manager didn't hesitate in moving us to a quieter section upstairs, and we enjoyed being served by a skilled young man named Ben. 

Perbacco is highly recommended. We'll be back.

excerpts: I hit pay dirt when I called Umberto the owner of Perbacco.
He was absolutely lovely to work with and extremely accommodating.
Umberto quickly helped me decide on a fixed menu (keeping it within my budget) and wine list.
He put together a beautiful table next day for my group of 15.
When we got there, he had a birthday card waiting for my son, and
personalized menus for each guest all done very classily!
He came by our table numerous times to make sure we had everything we needed and the waiter assigned to us was very attentive too.
All our guests (locals who had never been there) were super impressed and they will all definitely be going back to Perbacco.
Kudos to you Mr. Umberto for making a fantastic memory for my 20 yr old!
I'll be coming here for a meal the next time in to SFO for sure!
Love, Love, Love this place!

perbacco.review:

He came by our table numerous times to make sure we had everything we needed and the waiter assigned to us was very attentive too. Kudos to you Mr. Umberto for making a fantastic memory for my 20 yr old! I'll be coming here for a meal the next time in to SFO for sure!
Love, Love, Love this place!

excerpts: We always look forward to great meals in SF and we were not disappointed at Perbacco!
perbacco.author: Michael R.
perbacco.review: My wife and I experience great food and service.  Fantastic and creative pairings of flavors within each dish we enjoyed. Started with the beet salad/blackberry/Gorgonzola. Then Burrata paired with peaches/plum and toasted peppercorns. For mains I had 5 hour pork and porcini sugo over tagliatelle my wife had amazing cannelloni filled with corn and truffled ricotta. Like nothing we've had before. We always look forward to great meals in SF and we were not disappointed at Perbacco!

excerpts: Perbacco was very busy when I came for lunch
perbacco.author: Maya S.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco was very busy when I came for lunch so I suggest that reservations are in order. 

I had the Plin Al Brasato - tender pockets of pasta filled with flavorful short rib meat in a luscious truffle red wine sauce. For $19, this pasta was well worth it. 

I also tried the brussels sprouts and my friend's chicken dish - both were tasty and excellent. The brussels sprouts were tender and nicely salty. The chicken was moist and not overcooked. 

Service was friendly, although I didn't realize how loud it was in the restaurant until our waiter started speaking and I could barely hear him, although he was standing right in front of me. 

I'd love to return for dinner!

excerpts: Dined at Perbacco on (2/9/16) and was really impressed with their lunch service.
A relatively swanky stop for a Tuesday afternoon, it was packed full of the FiDi crowd and people were in/out quickly.
Their ability to get people seated and fed so quickly is truly a feat not meant for many restaurants in the area.
perbacco.author: Benjamin F.
perbacco.review:
Dined at Perbacco on (2/9/16) and was really impressed with their lunch service. A relatively swanky stop for a Tuesday afternoon, it was packed full of the FiDi crowd and people were in/out quickly. Their ability to get people seated and fed so quickly is truly a feat not meant for many restaurants in the area. It's a great stop for a business meeting and the pricing is super fair for the area. 

I didn't want to break out my phone to take pictures because I was chatting with a mentor and didn't want to be "that guy", but I will say the food was def photo worthy. I had the dover sole, beet salad, and we split the oxtail tagliatelle. All were very impressive. 

The only reason I'm holding it to 4 stars is because I want to come back for dinner and be wowed! Everything I had was definitely above par, but nothing screamed super original. Totally worth the trip though!

excerpts: Perbacco is one of the first places I call when I need a classy venue to host a corporate meal.
perbacco.author: Jenn C.
perbacco.review:
I have planned several events here, from simple networking lunches to private dinners for groups of 50+ with the guidance of their special events manager, Stephen. Each time, my inbox fills up with glowing "thank you" emails from my clients. Perbacco is one of the first places I call when I need a classy venue to host a corporate meal.

Not only is the food delicious, but they are accommodating to all kinds of allergies, not batting an eye when I tell them someone is allergic to dairy and gluten and does not eat red meat. It always feels like they go the extra mile to make sure everything goes smoothly and that even *I* as the main point of contact have an enjoyable time when I am running around making sure my event is going smoothly.

Aside from that, I have dined here on my own and enjoyed my experience here even as a regular patron. I lived in Italy for a period of time a few years ago and the food here, especially the pasta, remind me of that time.

excerpts: We've been to better restaurants in SF (like award-winning, Michelin star type of restaurants) that are way better and even more expensive than this place and not felt the uncomfortable, disgusting feeling we felt here at Perbacco.
We won't be back.
I don't recommend this place.
perbacco.author: Jessica O.
perbacco.review: Terrible vibe here. From the moment we walked in... we felt an uptight vibe. This place takes itself way too seriously. The food is just alright. Honestly, I felt uncomfortable here. We've been to better restaurants in SF (like award-winning, Michelin star type of restaurants) that are way better and even more expensive than this place and not felt the uncomfortable, disgusting feeling we felt here at Perbacco. We won't be back. I don't recommend this place.

excerpts: I would like to share our GREAT restaurant experience last evening at Perbacco in SF.
Simply put, a great price performer for 4;  and we have definitely added Perbacco to our list of family favorite restaurants.
perbacco.author: Jim C.
perbacco.review:
I would like to share our GREAT restaurant experience last evening at Perbacco in SF. http://www.perbaccosf.com  

The ambiance is warm and inviting. From the time the four of us stepped in the front door, we were made to feel like family; and it remained the same throughout the evening.  

The service was outstanding - from the bartender who created pre-dinner cocktails and hand walked them to our table, to the server who was knowledgeable about the menu selections, to two knowledgeable and friendly wine stewards who recommended a great selection for us- a 2011 Le Chiuse Brunello di Montalcino DOCG, Tuscany, Italy (we had 2 bottles). 

The food was wonderful and presented beautifully.  For appetizers we had FRITTO MISTO: shrimp / seasonal beans / piquillo pepper / olives / fennel / lemon aioli;  and LOCAL MOZZERELLA DI BUFALA: meyer lemon creme fraiche / house cured lonza / langhe hazelnuts.  

For the main courses, we had BROWN BUTTER ROASTED PORK CHOP: charred cabbage / passato di sancrau / lingonberry jus; WOLFE RANCH QUAIL: black chanterelle and sunchoke ragout / carrot puree / natural jus; and SEARED SEA SCALLOPS: brown butter cauliflower / black truffle salsa verde / caper butter.   

For desert, we had KAFFIR LIME LEAF PANNA COTTA: candied buddah hand / lemon balm / kishu mandarins / chamomile / poppy seed merengue; and BURNT CARAMEL GELATO: tahitian vanilla sea salt / pignoli cookie. 

Simply put, a great price performer for 4;  and we have definitely added Perbacco to our list of family favorite restaurants.

excerpts: Last night's dish n service lingered on my mind throughout today n brought back other fond experiences at Perbacco, so I found it hard not to just hop on here n get it off my chest.
perbacco.author: Colin M.
perbacco.review:
It was GAME OVER after saying "I do". Unlike the concept of utter demise on the usual marriage gone awfully wrong, the "Game Over" in context here is the same as "Dropping the Mic" or "This is it" or "There's nothing that can possibly top this" or "There's no returning to a mediocre life after this fate changing experience" or just simply "I win"..... Do you get what I'm saying? All they did was ask, "Do you want our white truffle from Alba, Italy to go along w that Agnolotti?" "I do." Game over. 

What led to this post today began last night at dinner:

PLIN DI TOPINAMBOUR - agnolotti filled with roasted sunchokes, ricotta, mascarpone, parmigiano reggiano topped w a generous layer of shaved White Truffle from Alba.

The simplicity of the dish itself makes it rely heavily on the nature of its ingredients and the chef's passion for its flavors n aromas.  A great house made pasta is always an extra star or 2 for me.  Service that matches the quality n mastery of its dishes is what makes it a 5 star here.  I've had plenty of other pleasant experiences here but never made it to write a review for them.  Last night's dish n service lingered on my mind throughout today n brought back other fond experiences at Perbacco, so I found it hard not to just hop on here n get it off my chest.

excerpts: Booked marked for centuries, finally got to Perbacco last night, a bit drenched from the pouring rain, but we made it.
I like Perbacco's decor.
Getting back to the point, I would not order the agnolotti again at Perbacco's.
Perbacco has great potential, but tonight it wasn't realized.

Maybe this is a restaurant that 
*used * to be good.
I don't know.
But if I base my judgement on last night's experience, it's a three at best.
I wonder if we ordered different things off the menu if that would have impacted our lack luster experience??
perbacco.author: Darien R.
perbacco.review:
Booked marked for centuries, finally got to Perbacco last night, a bit drenched from the pouring rain, but we made it.  Didn't have to deal with parking since we Ubered, but they do have valet.

Inside is very nice.  The fine dining vibe def comes through.  No crowded seating which was thrilling to see.  I hate when you come into a nice place and then they squeeze you into a tiny corner, 6 inches away from the couple at the next table.  Seriously, I'd rather give up my fine dining experience and go out for pizza somewhere than to be practically holding hands with the people eating next to us.  Can somebody explain that to some of these restaurant owners and managers that try to use every last square inch of their seating space!??

OK.  I'm done.

I like Perbacco's decor.  Clean and relaxing.

Our waiter was young and slightly inexperienced but he did a pretty good job, except no parmesan cheese offered--always had to request.  And the gnocchi came cold.  He gladly offered to reheat and it came back cold again.  I'm not sure if the blame should go to the server, but he ended up bringing a brand new order that was up to temperature.

Here's what we ingested:

PESCE CRUDO (HAMACHI) (2/5)  Low marks for the hamachi which was ever so slightly fishy and not impressive in the least.

ROASTED OCTOPUS - (4/5)  The folks at the table gave this dish a thumbs up.  Very small portion so don't plan to share unless you're a party of two.  

BURRATA W/PERSIMMON (2/5) If an appetizer with burrata is on the menu, we order it.  We've had our share of burrata appetizers.  By comparison, this one is at the bottom of the totem pole.  Underwhelming not only in portion size, but also the cheese lacked flavor and creaminess.  This one I would not recommend.

AGNOLOTTI (3/5) Filled with roasted meat and cabbage, many Yelpers sang its praises.  I liked it but didn't love it.  A bit too one note and salty for me.  After a few bites, you were looking for something else.  Best agnolotti that I've ever tasted came from Il Ristorante di Giorgio Baldi in LA. It's the AGNOLOTTI in CORN TRUFFLE SAUCE.  When you're in LA, please do yourself the favor of getting to that restaurant to eat that specific dish.  Getting back to the point, I would not order the agnolotti again at Perbacco's.

TAGLIATELLE w/VEAL RAGU (3/5)  My daughter didn't complain about this dish, but I'd like to take the opportunity to tell you what was wrong with this pasta dish.  First, the pasta itself was good, very good.  The problem was the veal ragu. It was dry, lacking flavor and uninviting. The ladle-ful of ragu was sitting in the middle of the pasta.  Normally, you would take one forkful of the pasta and the sauce in the center would start naturally start spreading over the plate and onto the unsauced pasta.  But not with this sauce.  It was too dry and not saucy at all, which is one of the biggest reasons this dish doesn't pass the test.  If you're going to put a sauce in the center, it needs to be saucy enough to work itself around the plate.  End of pasta sauce 101 tutorial.

BEEF LOIN & BRAISED SHORT RIB (3/5)  Another just OK dish.  On one side of the plate, one small braised short rib, and on the side was a very small slab of beef loin.  I didn't care for the short rib and I'm hard-pressed to tell you why.  The flavor not there, yes tender, but the sauce wasn't good.  The beef loin was good, and the little there was, I enjoyed it with the horseradish.

Perbacco has great potential, but tonight it wasn't realized.  Maybe this is a restaurant that 
*used * to be good.  I don't know.  But if I base my judgement on last night's experience, it's a three at best.  I wonder if we ordered different things off the menu if that would have impacted our lack luster experience??

excerpts: It was such a nice experience dining with Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Roxanne C.
perbacco.review: Had a great pasta and duck at this place. Most of all, customer service was fantastic. I believe we were served by 5 different people and all of them are attentive. A plastic wrap was accidentally left in our appetizer plate, when I told the server about it, he apologized and offered if we want to return and be served a new one. I said, it's fine, I just want to let them know. When he returned he said he took it off our tab. I think that was nice. The food quality wasn't really affected by the misplaced wrapper. At the end of out meal we were given free desserts because of the incident, I didn't expect that but it only shows how they value customer service. The food was delicious and our cocktails were unique and refreshing. It was such a nice experience dining with Perbacco.

excerpts: Oh man, Perbacco..
I can't pronounce your name or any of the items on your menu, but the pastas here are really some of the best I've had!
It was double date night and we had a reservation for 9 pm, but got there around 7.
We were absolutely famished and were lucky to be able to be seated immediately upon arrival.
The restaurant had a lot of open tables when we arrived, but filled up pretty quick!
: SF has so many amazing restaurants to try, and Perbacco is one of the ones I'd definitely want to come back to some time!
I'm definitely going to be dreaming about that burrata!
perbacco.author: Angel K.
perbacco.review:
Oh man, Perbacco.. I can't pronounce your name or any of the items on your menu, but the pastas here are really some of the best I've had! It was double date night and we had a reservation for 9 pm, but got there around 7. We were absolutely famished and were lucky to be able to be seated immediately upon arrival. The restaurant had a lot of open tables when we arrived, but filled up pretty quick! While waiting for our orders, we had bread sticks and bread with the most delicious pesto dip!

We ordered the burrata with strawberries as an appetizer and oh my goodness... this was one of the highlights of the meal. The cheese is so delicious with the strawberries and almonds, I think I could eat this every single day! For my entree, I ordered the gnocchi with chestnuts and persimmons (it had a much fancier name, sorry I didn't jot it down). It's not the fluffiest gnocchi I've ever had, but it had really good flavors. I haven't had chestnuts in a pasta dish before, it definitely was interesting! The boyfriend ordered agnolotti (again, it had a much fancier name) and this was really yummy! It was somewhat similar to a ravioli, except it was stuffed with delicious meats! I really enjoyed this dish! The other couple ordered tajarine (these noodles were like fresh ramen noodles, really tasty!) and pappardelle (had short rib and was definitely one of my other favorites of the night). 

At the end of our main courses we were completely stuffed! But for some reason still ordered two desserts to share. I ordered the salted chocolate cake with honeycomb and grapes and cherries. It was very delicious, but heavy. Definitely worth the try! The other couple ordered a panna cotta that had thyme in it. It was very interesting, although I have to say I preferred my cake better!

TL;DR: SF has so many amazing restaurants to try, and Perbacco is one of the ones I'd definitely want to come back to some time! I'm definitely going to be dreaming about that burrata!

excerpts: Perbacco is perhaps the best restaurant in FiDi.
perbacco.author: Massimo M.
perbacco.review:
Adding one star. Today's lunch was impeccable. The grilled squid app was amazing, lightly grilled, with green leaves, and beans with a light paste. Wow...

Entree was Raviora, butternut squash ravioli. I cannot describe it any better than flawless. Washed down by Rosso di Montalcino ($15x2). Perbacco is perhaps the best restaurant in FiDi.

excerpts: From the beautiful setting to the service and the lovely food Perbacco is the full package.
Perbacco also caters to vegetarians...and not in a half ass way.
perbacco.author: David G.
perbacco.review:
One of my fav restaurants in all of San Francisco!

First ate here to celebrate the ipo of opentable. I was blown away back than and every single time I have come back; it never disappoints!

From the beautiful setting to the service and the lovely food Perbacco is the full package. No wonder the place was totally packed for lunch on a Tuesday at the end of the Summer lull.

The pastas are always amazing. My Gnocchi, with duck ragu, was really light and bursting with flavor. The Gnocchi was not lumpy or heavy just light pillows of potato goodness. My little Gem salad was a nice lightly dressed salad with lovely fresh veggies. 

My partner had the Brussel sprouts which were delightfully cooked with a sprinkling of cheese. His Tonno Salad looked really good as well.

Perbacco also caters to vegetarians...and not in a half ass way. You can get a really lovely vegetarian meal here with great flavors and textures.

Wine list is phenomenal.

It is pricey but it is sooo worth it.

Finally the owner Umberto is such a gentlemen (in his prince of wales plaid suit) and wonderful operator of this lovely dinning establishment you cannot  help but feel the love and care that goes into this place.

Mille grazie signor Gibin!

perbacco.author: Stella M.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is a nice upscale Italian restaurant situated in the financial district in SF. You can take a stroll along the Ferry building, see the Bay Bridge from afar, and even drop by the Cupid's Span and then plan a little dinner at Perbacco since it's walking distance.

The overall ambience of the place was nice. It was chic and modern. One side of the wall were bricks decorated with a span of mirror that ran across. It was nice because if you are sitting on the other side of the table facing the wall you're not just limited to look at the wall. You are able to see the whole restaurant and be immersed in its overall ambience. And I believe ambience is key at any restaurant. The place was dimly lite but not too dark. It gives off a nice romantic feel which isn't bad for an Italian place since it would be perfect to bring your date... Overall I like the overall feel of the restaurant.

To jump into the food... 

My friend and I started off with their Pesce Crudo (4/5) which was really good. The hamachi was really fresh which was really surprisingly since it's an Italian place. The whole dish had a lot of different flavors going on but surprisingly everything went really well together. I would definitely recommend trying this dish.  

For our entrees, we got their Duck Rissotto (4/5) and Pappardelle w. Lamb Ragu (4/5). The duck risotto was very creamy and rich and yet had this hint of sweetness that accentuated the dish. The Pappardelle was cooked al dente which I love. I've tried Pappardelle at other places and sometimes it's really bad bc they undercook the pasta but Perbacco was right on with the texture of the dish. I was impressed. The lamb was very tender and moist and wasn't gamey. Both dishes were excellent. 

For dessert we got their Lemon Thyme Panna Cotta (3/5) which was a very pretty dish with an array of fruits and nuts. Loved the side of sorbet which was very refreshing. The panna cotta was good and you could definitely taste the thyme but I've had better. 

Our waiter gave us an extra dessert for free! Yay free food! He gave us their Hazel Nut Meringue which was good... there was chunks of hazel nut embedded into the meringue... I can't complain it was free. 

To end the dining experience they also handed out petite four at the end that consisted of chocolate and a nut based chew... it was good but I was uncomfortably full at that point... 

Overall it was a nice meal. Our waiter was nice and was very attentive to us. Made sure our wine glasses were full at all times... Oh we ordered a bottle of Barbera upon recommendation from our waiter and it was very good... Yum! :) If you're in the area you should definitely check this place out!

excerpts: Not a deal breaker since Perbacco does get packed after work on the weekdays.
It's a nice place to grab dinner before heading home on BART/MUNI but
perbacco.author: Janetto L.
perbacco.review:
Meh, service was nice, but rather abrupt and not too attentive.  Not a deal breaker since Perbacco does get packed after work on the weekdays.  It's a nice place to grab dinner before heading home on BART/MUNI but don't expect to meet clients here as it is almost impossible to carry a conversation through all the noise.

Food was good, but nothing memorable stood out.  Execution of each dish had a few ups and downs, I was expecting a lot from their Pappardelle w/ Shortrib Ragu dish but sadly, it was just ok.  I do appreciate that they properly cooked the fresh pasta though, nice and al dente. 

Highlight of the night was definitely the pesto that came with the bread and breadsticks, yum yum!  Our waiter also brought out meringues for the birthday girl which was a nice gesture to end the evening.

I won't go out of my way to come here, but if I'm in the area...I may meet up a few friends for drinks and a quick bite.  Check out their sister restaurant, Barbacco, I think I prefer the more casual setting + menu offering there more.

excerpts: Since I had an OpenTable gift card for $100, I thought why not try Perbacco!
It's been on my list of places to try for a while now.
We had a 6pm reservation on Fri 5/9.
Parking was pretty easy.
After taking into account the food, service, and price, I'd say Perbacco is a solid 3 stars.
perbacco.author: Elena N.
perbacco.review:
Came here about a month ago for an early Mother's day dinner. Since I had an OpenTable gift card for $100, I thought why not try Perbacco! It's been on my list of places to try for a while now. We had a 6pm reservation on Fri 5/9. Parking was pretty easy. We found a spot a block over a little before 6pm.

Complimentary breadsticks with pesto - I love pesto, but this was just bland! Plus with the crunchy breadsticks it was actually a little messy which I didn't like. Who wants to drip pesto on tablecloths?!

Salumi misti ($29 for a large) - A selection of house cured salumi inspired by traditional piemontese recipes. There was a good amount of meats, but none of them stood out except the pate. They were all a little lackluster and didn't have much flavor. I don't get why this was/is on the 7x7 list.

Pesce crudo ($15) - Hamachi, shaved hearts of palm, blood orange, kumquat, serrano pepper. I love hamachi, hearts of palm and serrano pepper. I wasn't sure if I would like the kumquat but it didn't make the dish overly sweet so I didn't mind it.

Piastra roasted octopus and pork belly ($14) - Olive oil crushed potatoes, salsa verde, celery fennel salad. The octopus was a little tough. And I love chewy octopus! The flavors blended well together, but I had a texture problem with this dish.

Seared sea scallops ($31) - Hearts of palm and seasonal citrus ragout, sea urchin, chrysanthemum. Good thing I like hearts of palm cuz it was in this dish too! The scallops were nicely cooked. The sea urchin added a lovely subtle touch.

Pappardelle ($19 for a large) - Wide pasta ribbons, slow cooked short rib ragu, grated horseradish. The pasta was perfectly cooked! And the short rib was nicely stewed, but together, something just didn't gel. The sauce didn't seem to bring the meat and pasta together.

Dry aged liberty farm duck breast ($28) - Stone fruit radicchio panzanella, basil, apricot duck rillettes. I don't know why, but the duck itself had no flavor. The skin didn't have that nice crispiness I love when it's browned on a pan. Not sure how they cooked it, but maybe it was sous vide and then put on the plate? I also didn't care for the panzanella as it was too sweet.

Wolfe ranch quail breast filled with wild mushrooms ($32) - Potato puree, chard, wild mushrooms. I don't really remember this dish so I can't really comment. I do adore mushrooms and chard. And with quail it should be a winning combo.

New potatoes tossed in herb butter ($6) - Sea salt. The most disappointing dish of the night. I rarely order potatoes as a side but I was craving some buttery carbs so I decided to get this dish. The potatoes were under cooked and underseasoned. Not good at all! 

Olive oil panna cotta ($10) - Sprouted almonds, borage, strawberry white balsamic sauce, rhubarb sorbetto. We ordered this based on the recommendation of our server. I liked this dessert better than the one my dad chose. The panna cotta was nice and silky and creamy. The sauce and sorbetto complimented it well.

Mascarpone cheesecake ($10) - Pistachio sponge, poached rhubarb, candied kumquats, mandarin sorbetto. I didn't care for this dessert. The cheesecake was lighter than I expected and didn't hold up to the pistachio and fruit flavors. It didn't feel like the cheesecake was the star of the dish.

Our server was nice and attentive through most of the meal. Remember to ask for bread and butter if you want it. I didn't read the menu til we got our Salumi misti and had to find our server to get some bread to go with the dish. I think if you order it they should ask you if you want bread.

I debated giving this place 3 or 3.5 stars. After taking into account the food, service, and price, I'd say Perbacco is a solid 3 stars.

excerpts: The staff is well trained at Perbacco.
We were seated at a table that just wasn't going to work--a small table where one diner would have to face a brick wall.
I am not a fan of when the hostess seats patrons at the most unwanted tables first.
We politely asked the owner to change us to a different table and he moved us to table 53 without a problem.
Great table!!
perbacco.author: Thomas D.
perbacco.review:
Service is stellar - it's that noticeable.  The staff is well trained at Perbacco.
We were seated at a table that just wasn't going to work--a small table where one diner would have to face a brick wall.  I am not a fan of when the hostess seats patrons at the most unwanted tables first.  We politely asked the owner to change us to a different table and he moved us to table 53 without a problem.  Great table!!  As a side note, our original table was left empty for the rest of the night.........

After that misstep, service began and it just kept getting better and better.  What a team!
We shared the vitello tonnato and two appetizer sized pastas: the pappardelle and the tajarin.
The lamb sugo in the pappardelle was the favorite.
Their full bar kept our vodka martinis coming to our table without delay.

I had the pan seared beef loin and braised short rib for my main course.  My partner had the seared scallops. Both were paired with a glass of wine with help from the sommelier.  Mine was a glass of Italian wine from the area around Venice--very nice.
We are so spoiled living in SF and have become accustomed to incredible food,  That is the reason for the 4 star rating.  The food is very good--not great.

Dessert was the Angel Food cake with seared peaches and plums.

Dinner for two with tip: $287.00

excerpts: Went to Perbacco for a work lunch, and I have to say that it's definitely out of my comfort zone.
perbacco.author: Nadeem A.
perbacco.review:
Went to Perbacco for a work lunch, and I have to say that it's definitely out of my comfort zone.  I normally go to quick places, so a sit down place with white table cloths is definitely not the norm.

I ordered the risotto, which on that day was described as "braised point reyes porcini mushrooms, caramelized onion, spinach, and la tur cheese" and a side of fingerling roasted potatoes. 

Overall, the food and experience was great.  While I wouldn't go again just for a regular lunch, I would definitely recommend it for a special lunch.

excerpts: For cocktails, our orders were a nice extra dirty martini and their Perbacco cocktail that was so exquisitely refreshing we have been wanting to create this exact cocktail at home.
For starters, we went with the roasted octopus which had nice big pieces in olive oil, potatoes, shaved radishes, vinaigrette and salsa verde.
SUPERB!
I then had the dry aged liberty farm duck breast that was so moist and creatively done with apricot mostrada, stonefruit and watercress salad.
AMAZING!
My boyfriend had the pappardelle wide ribbon pasta with slow cooked short rib ragu and horseradish.
The pasta was perfect with an ideal compliment from the richness of the short rib.
Service was impeccable and our waiter had a lot of knowledge in wine recommendations for our meal.
Having dinner at Perbacco was an outstanding choice for our first night back in San Francisco.
perbacco.author: Kelly P.
perbacco.review: What an incredible dining experience when wanting upscale Italian cuisine.  When you first walk in, you sense a cool, hip and classy atmosphere.  An attractive after work crowd gathers dressed in suits and work attire but you also see tourists and locals who are dressed casually hip which is also part of the vibe from fabulous this place.  We landed a nice seat in the dining room in the middle of the restaurant that was busy and bustling on a Friday night.  For cocktails, our orders were a nice extra dirty martini and their Perbacco cocktail that was so exquisitely refreshing we have been wanting to create this exact cocktail at home.  For starters, we went with the roasted octopus which had nice big pieces in olive oil, potatoes, shaved radishes, vinaigrette and salsa verde.  SUPERB!  I then had the dry aged liberty farm duck breast that was so moist and creatively done with apricot mostrada, stonefruit and watercress salad.  AMAZING!  My boyfriend had the pappardelle wide ribbon pasta with slow cooked short rib ragu and horseradish.  The pasta was perfect with an ideal compliment from the richness of the short rib.  Service was impeccable and our waiter had a lot of knowledge in wine recommendations for our meal.  Having dinner at Perbacco was an outstanding choice for our first night back in San Francisco.

excerpts: This is the 2nd time I've had lunch @ Perbacco, and it didn't disappoint.
we started off with the marinated roasted beets, Fritto Misto of Shrimp, Burrata cheese, and olives.
I think we could have just had that for lunch everything was filling and delicious.
For our main course I had the risotto it was
oh, so creamy and the portion was huge.
My coworker had the duck, She enjoyed it...
the boss had the meatballs.
and 2 others had the pan seared hanger steak.
Can I suggest their brown butter Brussel Sprouts, fingerling Potatos and Squash (squash had a very nice sweet taste to it)
everything looked so delicious, needless to say every one cleaned their plate out.
I was already busting out of my pants, but I had to try dessert...
perbacco.author: Claudia E.
perbacco.review:
Came here for our holiday dept. lunch. This is the 2nd time I've had lunch @ Perbacco, and it didn't disappoint. we started off with the marinated roasted beets, Fritto Misto of Shrimp, Burrata cheese, and olives.  I think we could have just had that for lunch everything was filling and delicious.   For our main course I had the risotto it was oh, so creamy and the portion was huge. My coworker had the duck, She enjoyed it...the boss had the meatballs.  and 2 others had the pan seared hanger steak. Can I suggest their brown butter Brussel Sprouts, fingerling Potatos and Squash (squash had a very nice sweet taste to it) everything looked so delicious, needless to say every one cleaned their plate out.  I was already busting out of my pants, but I had to try dessert...LOL!!!! 

We got apple sorbet (real good), Brutti Ma Buoni. (a merengue like with hazelnuts inside). dark chocolate Bonet, and cappucino's  to keep us from not going into a food coma.

Service?   Our Server was excellent. kept our glasses full of sparkling water, refilling our drinks. and checking up on us every 15-20 minutes.

excerpts:
The food was SO good here - so glad we were able to get last minute resos to Perbacco.

Desserts are also good, but the main features at Perbacco really are the pastas.

I think Perbacco is one of the restaurants to eat in SF, and undoubtedly so! 5 star in my books and the best restaurant I tried while in SF.
perbacco.author: Charlotte W.
perbacco.review:
Wow! The food was SO good here - so glad we were able to get last minute resos to Perbacco.

The pasta here is really, really good - and they come in small or dinner portions so if you're not feeling too hungry, you can still have a taste. I had the Agnolotti (YUM) while others at the table had the Gnocchi, Shortrib Pappardelle, and Risotto. For starters, I had the Peach and Mushroom appetizer and wow - I could have had two more plates of that.

Great wine selection, including some glasses that you can try through the Corovin method. This is a neat contraption where a slim microscopic needle pierces the cork and allows the wine to drain through - such that the cork is never removed ensuring constant freshness of the wine. It's pricey starting with the one I had at $25 but boy it was good.

Service was amazing - my husband had ordered a side of Brussel sprouts and when asked about it, the waiter apologized profusely and said he misunderstood and didn't catch it. We decided not to get it even though he said it would only take a few minutes. We still said no (not maliciously but we were happy with ou plates). Our waiter still brought it out complimentary. That was really great.

Desserts are also good, but the main features at Perbacco really are the pastas.

Great space: modern, sleek, and actually quite large (two floors). I think Perbacco is one of the restaurants to eat in SF, and undoubtedly so! 5 star in my books and the best restaurant I tried while in SF.

excerpts: That's what I realized the moment I walked into Perbacco's sister restaurant, Barbacco, where we had a dinner reservation for our one grown-up date night in San Francisco.
I just need a good meal, not a fancy restaurant --
or so I'd figured when making our reservation.
perbacco.author: Alexandra S.
perbacco.review:
There comes a time in every woman's life when she realizes she needs a tablecloth to be happy. A tablecloth, and a cocktail.

That's what I realized the moment I walked into Perbacco's sister restaurant, Barbacco, where we had a dinner reservation for our one grown-up date night in San Francisco.  I just need a good meal, not a fancy restaurant -- or so I'd figured when making our reservation. Who needs pretension? 

It turns out that *I* need pretension...or at least a cocktail list. When we walked into the noisy Barbacco and discovered that they only served beer and wine, we popped next door into the serenity of Barbacco and were thrilled that they were able to seat us.

Even though the restaurant was crowded and noisy, the acoustics meant that we were able to have a quiet conversation without difficulty. The service was excellent -- almost too prompt! We ate a two-course dinner in barely more than an hour.

The food itself was excellent: we had a delicious fritto misto and salad to start, followed by two very good, meaty pasta dishes. We were grateful that the waiter explained their cuisine comes from a region of Italy known for its meat dishes, since that let us focus our choices. For the same reason, it's not a great choice for vegetarians, even though they have vegetarian options.

I gave the restaurant four instead of five stars simply because it wasn't one of those mind-boggling meals that I'll remember for years. But it really was a very good dinner, in a very good restaurant.

And the cocktail -- that I *will* remember for years. Not just because I was grateful for a full bar, but because it was literally the best cocktail I've ever had: the Senza Nome, made from equila, cantaloupe juice, aperol, lime and basil syrup. Wow!

excerpts: Perbacco was recommended to us and I would definitely come back and recommend it to others.
I saw some guests dressed up, some were very casual.
perbacco.author: Tim L.
perbacco.review:
Although I can't pronounce more than half the items on the menu, this place was spectacular. Came here for the first time for a birthday celebration and the evening was great. There was a birthday card placed at our table by the time we were seated. Small detail, big plus! Our waiter, with a heavy (I like to call authentic) Italian accent, went really in depth when describing the dishes we were interested in. I was able to try 8~10 dishes including appetizers since we all share a bit with each other. Other than the eggplant, I have nothing bad to say about any of the dishes. And I'm biased because I've never really enjoyed eggplants. 

Perbacco was recommended to us and I would definitely come back and recommend it to others. I saw some guests dressed up, some were very casual. It seems to be good for all occasions!  

P.S. don't skip on the dessert, So. So. Good

Cliffs: Great food, great service. Dress up or down, try it out!

excerpts: Was visiting San Francisco and wanted a nice "Italian" dinner so decided to try out Perbacco.
Our waiter was unpleasant and the menu didn't really scream Italian food.
Either way, we ordered the "carne cruda" which is essentially beef tartare.
Approximately 17 min later my boyfriend is sick in the bathroom.
Approximately one hour later I'm sick in the bathroom.
This goes on for the next 12 hours.
Either our waiter played a really bad joke or they don't know how to handle raw food.
Either way, I give one star for my food poisoning experience and ruining my first trip to SF.

Either our waiter played a really bad joke or they don't know how to handle raw food. Either way, I give one star for my food poisoning experience and ruining my first trip to SF.

excerpts: Perbacco is upscale in decor, romantically lit but a loud atmosphere with a large space to accommodate a higher capacity of people.
perbacco.author: Elizabeth S.
perbacco.review:
The girls and I had reservations for four of us one evening.  They seated us at a four top table at the main aisle near a column.  We had chosen a perfect restaurant to all get together.  Perbacco is upscale in decor, romantically lit but a loud atmosphere with a large space to accommodate a higher capacity of people.

We brought in a nice bottle of bubbly, and they chilled it for us.  The breadsticks with some dip was a nice touch but, they turned out to be stale.  Our waitress made up for it by bringing fat, warm, soft dinner rolls with our entrees later though.  She was also very patient, personable in dealing with us.  Sometimes when a bunch of us haven't seen each other in a few months, we get very chatty and lose focus on ordering!  I was able to get everyone in line to make up their minds though.  

We ordered a nice bottle of sav blanc for the table.  As an appetizer, we ordered the Fritto Misto of Shrimp under the recommendation of our waitress for sharing.  It was pretty good and interesting.  I never had green olives tempura style though.  It was a good choice for us though.

I ordered the duck breast with parsnips, radicchio and roasted pears.  It was quite the exquisite dish and a harmonious concoction of flavors.  It was nice to indulge in duck other than the typical Peking style I'm used to.  Two of my gf's ordered sea bass which I did a little quality control on and approved of!  My other friend had the Pappardelle which was wide pasta ribbons with some shortrib ragu.  Omg...  This was amazing, carbolicious pleasure!  Since, she was from out of town, I took hers home with the rest of my entree I didn't finish.

Halfway through the meal, we realized they forgot about our Veuve Clicquot.  They brought it out towards the end which was fine, but by then we couldn't finish or walk out of there overly tipsy!  

I'm not a fan of splitting the bill four ways unless you're armed with cash, but they did it for us.  Shame on me for not coming more prepared!

I would undoubtedly return.  We were a handful being so engrossed in our conversations to acknowledge staff sometimes.  Thanks for the excellence in service, with great attitude, friendliness and of course the unique, delicious Italian fare!

excerpts: but I'll be back to Perbacco every time I'm in town
perbacco.author: William D.
perbacco.review: Everything was very good here no reason to complicate this .  We were all very happy, service was excellent as well .   I'm just a visitor but I'll be back to Perbacco every time I'm in town

excerpts: Let me start to say - I love Perbacco, and that is why writing this review is difficult to write.
I often bring work colleagues and clients for lunch to Perbacco - the food is consistently amazing and the service discrete but attentive.
I took 4 people for lunch today and had a wonderful lunch - at the end of the meal we all surprisingly decided to go for a glass of port.

I ordered the table 4 glasses of Tawny Port 20 years old ($20 per glass), this took over 20 minutes to arrive at the table which was surprising as our table was next to the bar and we were one of the few tables still occupied in the restaurant.
One of guests who loves port commented it was not a 20 year port but much younger - as I'm not a port expert
I thought I'd ask to see the bottle to show my guest.
I asked our waiter if he could bring us the bottle and some 20minutes
later he appeared with an empty port bottle - a 20 year Tawny port.
I asked why it took so long to reach over the bar and how come it was empty - there was no response.

The bottle had been washed out so I could not show my guest that what we were drinking was really a Tawny 20, and the restaurant had no other bottles.........it all seemed very fishy and we all felt we had been served a sub-standard drink and not what we had ordered.
This may all sound snobbish but at $20 a glass
I think a wonderful restaurant of this caliber could have managed this situation far better......
I left with a $340 bill feeling like I'd been ripped off and taken advantage of.
Will I return?
Sadly I feel the spell of Perbacco has been broken......
UPDATE*******i received a call from the owner - a lovely gentleman - who explained the mix up with the port and very graciously apologized.
I made a lunch reservation and took a client to Perbacco that week and was warmly greeted by the owner.
We were also treated to a complimentary and delicious appetizer!
The magic is back!
