excerpts: My wife and I have eaten at Perbacco in the past and have been pleased.
However, this visit we were disappointed.
For the price, the menu needs help.
It almost appears that the chef is trying too hard to have unusual entrees.
We dine in the City often and will not return to Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Thomas H.
perbacco.review:
My wife and I have eaten at Perbacco in the past and have been pleased.  However, this visit we were disappointed.  For the price, the menu needs help.  It almost appears that the chef is trying too hard to have unusual entrees.  This is not the place if you are looking for an excellent steak, seafood or real Italian dishes.  

Everything from the appetizers to the main entrees is a little like the Iron Chef ingredients.  We dine in the City often and will not return to Perbacco.  Obviously, it is rated highly by several diners, but fell way short in our opinion.  

We had a party of six and to a person, we were looking at each other wondering what has gone wrong with this restaurant.  My recommendation is to delete a number of items on the menu and add a nice steak, seasonal sea food and some traditional Italian dishes.  Completely change the  appetizer menu.  We ordered a couple items and to be honest, they were hardly edible.

excerpts: The event was very well executed at Perbacco and I would recommend it for a business meeting of 9-15.
perbacco.author: Danielle V.
perbacco.review:
I went here for a customer product review last night. The event was very well executed at Perbacco and I would recommend it for a business meeting of 9-15. 

We arrived, checked our bags, and went upstairs to the room that had been well prepared for us. Champagne greeted us at the entry way and a working table was set up complete with video projector. Had some time to network and enjoy some fabulous apps. About 8 different choices came out and they were easily edible with your fingers in 1-2 bites. Each item was plated beautifully and sophisticated in taste and texture. (fig, prosciutto & blue cheese, mushroom risotto ball, grilled shrimp with amazing dipping sauce, hamachi, burrata with tomato & basil)

After the working part of the meeting we had a four course meal: Octopus, strawberry arugula salad, scallops and panna cotta. (The other alternative was braised short rib which looked amazing too.) Service was great, the food was awesome and the space well suited to what we were doing. Nice and private.

excerpts: So, good job, Perbacco at making menus that sound enticing and food that LOOKS yummy...
perbacco.author: Gwen Y.
perbacco.review:
It's really JUST ok, and I would not go back.  It's expensive, service (even at a non-busy time!) was SUPER slow, and the waiter was rude and stuck up and just...acted weird every time we asked him (very politely!) for something normal.  We were like scared to ask him for anything bc he would give us weird attitude.  

More importantly, the food is not as good as it sounds or looks.  I was disappointed, bc the descriptions on the menu and the photos on yelp make it look so good.  It is surprisingly less tasty than it looks (which is a weird thing Ive never really come across before....) 

So, good job, Perbacco at making menus that sound enticing and food that LOOKS yummy...

excerpts: Usually when you go to restaurants such as Perbacco
the sides are tiny which is why we all ordered two sides for ourselves.
Our server let us know that the sides are huge and basically are considered family style.
How nice is that?
perbacco.author: Christina M.
perbacco.review:
I love this place! It's sooooooo good. Quality for sure. Service was impeccable (I don't usually use that word but hey I needed something extraordinary).

Side note: Since I fell in love with this place the first time I wanted to celebrate my bday here this year however they are all booked! Seee I told you they're good.

First of all our server was super smart, nice, considerate, professional, understanding and welcoming. I came here with two other friends and we each ordered our entrees as well as sides. Usually when you go to restaurants such as Perbacco the sides are tiny which is why we all ordered two sides for ourselves. Our server let us know that the sides are huge and basically are considered family style. How nice is that? She let us know and was super chill.

On to the food:

They start you off with super fluffy soft focaccia bread, yummy bread sticks with pesto sauce. All totally worth eating.

Short Ribs Pappardelle:  Order this! This was such an amazing dish. The short ribs were super tender and the pappardelle (pasta) was very fresh and melt in your mouth amazing!

Petrale Sole over arugala and cherry tomatoes: Sounds super simple and it is but they cook this so well it tastes so good. They give you a really good portion. Delicious.

Pan Seared Hanger Steak: Beautiful dish and very good if you're really hungry!

Sides: 
Potatoes: YUM
Brussel Sprouts: Again very good
Turnips: Not so much, lol but that could be due to the nature of this vegetable in general
Carrots: great!

Dessert:
Candied Hazelnut Cake with poached pears and pear sorbetto: Must get this, I mean who woulda thought...pear sorbetto (yums!)

Luv this place!

Perbacco should think about selling them in bulk, I know at least two people that would buy that!

So I finally had dinner at Perbacco yesterday, I've been wanting to visit for quite some time.  The interior is really nice, upscale, and has a casual elegant atmosphere.  For a Tuesday night, I was surprised how crowded it was, so my suggestion is to always make reservations.  Now onto the meal:

-Salumi Misti (a selection of house cured meats)- OMG, this was great! The smaller version comes with 3 types of salami, 3 types of house made pate on crispy bread, a piece of terrine, and two different kinds of lardo.  My favorite was definitely the pork terrine, I think I am now a terrine addict.  Accompanied with the house made bread, this is a meal within itself. YUM.

-Farfalle Nere (squid ink pasta and crispy octopus)- I've had squid ink pasta in NYC before and it was delicious. So I couldn't pass up the opportunity to be adventurous and order it again.  They did a great job, the farfalle was perfectly "al-dente." and the pasta tasted fresh from the sea. The octopus was perfectly cooked, tender and with a slight bounce in the bite.

-Pappardelle (wide pasta with slow cooked short rib ragu)- Tasty! I've had this dish many times at other restaurants and homemade as well, it's ALWAYS a winner. It taste good and feels comforting.  The short ribs were tender and sauce was flavorful with accents of sweetness and savory.  

-Meyer Lemon Panna Cotta w/ Rosemary shortbread- I am already a big fan of panna cotta and with the meyer lemon it was the perfect end to the meal.  The panna cotta was light and creamy and combined with the huckleberry compote, it had the perfect finish.  We shared the dessert because the two pastas had us on "carbo load." My friend really liked the Rosemary shortbread cookies, I agree they were really good. Perbacco should think about selling them in bulk, I know at least two people that would buy that!

This place is definitely great and the price is reasonable for the amount of food. Its always great to share, especially when its Italian food, there are so many appealing choices.

excerpts: I never had noticed Perbacco until the St. Patty's Day block party, while I was walking to Wayfare (which was full, so I ended up at Wexler's).
I came in search of a Bellini, only to find a Bellisimo.
Perbacco, please bring back the truffled egg toast
so I can try it.
Please please please please please!
perbacco.author: Elaine N.
perbacco.review:
The one thing I hate about Italian restaurants is the pronunciation. I always have the impression that the accents are the same as Spanish accents. Is that the case? No. Me always gets to look stupid. Sadface.

I never had noticed Perbacco until the St. Patty's Day block party, while I was walking to Wayfare (which was full, so I ended up at Wexler's). I came in search of a Bellini, only to find a Bellisimo. I can't remember what was in it (champagne, blood orange, etc.), but it was enough to make me return for another.

My first experience here was nothing memorable. Bartenders loitered around the place and conversed among themselves. I sat at the bar on a Friday evening, ready to fill my spacious tummy with lots of unhealthy goodies. By the end, my tummy was only halfway filled and my wallet was $75 emptier. Sheesh. I really liked my raviolo, but just one? C'mon, I'm dying of hunger! Boo. My halibut was good, but I still craved more raviolo. Raviolo was truffley, yolky, goodness. For dessert, I had the bonet, which I didn't really like. It was like chocolate pudding with some caramel sauce and whipped cream. Bleh. By the end? I ended up eating dinner part two at another restaurant in the area.

I remember the second time a bit differently, but it could have been from the Bellisimos and champagne. The atmosphere was different. A good different. They served focaccia instead of the hard, tooth-chipping bread they served during dinner. I requested the bar menu in hopes of having some truffled egg toast, but it wasn't on the menu anymore. Sadface. I simply ordered the Catelvetrano olives with the burrata cheese. Holy ravivioli, pat me on the back! You have to try the burrata cheese, you just have to! Wow.

There was a man next to me who kept me company. He raved about their meatballs, he even let me sample some of his dish. I still thought the burrata cheese was a better choice, though (:

For dessert, I had chocolate mousse. It was so much better than the bonet, I swear on the holy grail. I let my companion have a taste, to which he said, "Mmmm!" He's not even a dessert person, proof that you should get the mousse!

On top of that, the bartender was this amicable little Spanish man. He was always very attentive to everyone's needs and made sure we were all happy. We talked about Quince, which was how I found out that I had been pronouncing it incorrectly. Boo.

Someone mentioned finding a cockroach. Well, I found a translucent red bug (about the size of an ant) on the side of my burrata plate. I wasn't sure if it came with the plate, or if it had gotten on there afterwards, but it doesn't distract from how good the burrata cheese is. GET THE BURRATA CHEESE! Oh, and pair it with a Bellisimo.

Perbacco, please bring back the truffled egg toast so I can try it. Please please please please please!

excerpts: Perbacco really needs to remove this from the menu.
Why, Perbacco???
I'm a fan of Barbacco, but sorry Perbacco, I cannot come by again.
perbacco.author: Jocelyn L.
perbacco.review:
I recently had one of the worst pastas I've ever had in my life- no exaggeration- at what I thought was one of the better Italian restaurants in the city. 

The dinner started out good for our party of 6. 
Service was attentive, drinks were yummy. 

The salumi platter we had as our shared  appetizer  was pretty tasty save for an overly pungent pate. 

Then it kinda went downhill from there. 
More than half the table got individual appetizers of Summer melons which the server did a great job of over-selling to us. 
Don't get me wrong, the 4 slices of melons were super juicy. 
For $14. 
Ummm, what? 
Sure there was shaved parm on it making it somewhat diff (but not necessarily tasty). But the price was exorbitant and my 4 year old goddaughter could have plated it much better. 
The melons were just thrown on a plate.

Then came my 2 entrees; I ordered the smaller portion of the Tagliatelle with 5 hour pork sugo and the Agnolotti del pin. 

The moment the server set the tagliatelle down, I was like...is that the tagliatelle?!? He very apprehensively said 'yes'; which makes me think I'm not the first person to ask that question.
The tagliatelle was cut so thin, it looked like a plate of cheap instant college ramen, topped with chef boyardee canned sauce sitting on a bed of oil.
But I thought, oh well, I'll give it a try. 
I was horrified. 
It tasted worst than it looked. 
The tagliatelle was overcooked, the sauce was terrible; it tasted like canned sauce and where was the porcini mushroom?
I can't imagine Anyone thinks this is a good pasta dish- Perbacco really needs to remove this from the menu. 

Someone else in my party ordered the tagliatelle as a bigger entree and only took 3 bites; the poor girl went home starving. The look of disgust on her face said it all. 
Inattentive of the server not to have noticed the almost-full dish. Bad call. 

The agnolotti was passably better. 
Having just had Flour + Water's melt in your mouth flavorful Agnolotti recently, this was a subpar version. The pasta was too hard, it wasn't tasty and it was disappointing. 
I finished the dish only coz I was famished and couldn't eat the ramen disguised as tagliatelle. 

The dessert was also disappointing. I really wanted to wash my taste buds from the terrible pasta entrees but the bambolinis were filled with some tart nasty jelly that tasted like a cross between kiwi and kumquat. 
Why, Perbacco??? Why????

If it wasn't for the fact that I was at a biz dinner with acquaintances i just met, i would have sent the dishes back. Thank goodness I didn't have to pay a single cent for dinner. 

I'm a fan of Barbacco, but sorry Perbacco, I cannot come by again.

excerpts: I would give Perbacco 6 stars if I could!

Copied this straight from their website.
perbacco.author: Susan C.
perbacco.review:
I would give Perbacco 6 stars if I could!

"Perbacco" is an Italian word to accentuate positive comments.  Copied this straight from their website.  The restaurant lives upto their name!

A group of us came here for lunch and so I had bites of most of the dishes.  Appetizer:  veal slices with lemon and albacore sauce with capers and some micro sprouts (radish?), grilled squid, greens salad with very light lemony vinaigrette, brussel sprouts with carmelized shallots.  Mains:  ravioli with meyer lemon and ricotta, tagliatelle, truffle with herb gnocchi with wild mushrooms, lamb stew in white sauce, and pappardelle with braised short ribs.  It was all very very delicious!  I loved the gnocchi and tagliatelle.

All their pastas are made by hand on site.  You can taste the freshness and the fine ingredients.

Ask for breadsticks and foccacia -- latter was delish!

Their food is regional - both Piedmont and Liguria so lots of fresh seafood dishes on their menu.  The wine list is huge.  We didn't order any but I'm sure they'll help you to navigate through it.

We were too full to order any dessert.

I can't remember our servers name but she was awesome.  Great service is the cherry on top for this awesome meal!

Piastra Roasted Octopus - awesome and perfectly cooked; one of the best dishes of the night; interesting use of the beans here
Garganelli - second best dish of the night; perfectly cooked pasta consistency; right amount of sauce; super tasty
Tajarin - I wanted this to be good so badly but horrible, horrible execution; pasta was overcooked and sitting in a pool of oil or butter which meant the sauce did not stick; sauce itself was way underseasoned (added a few pinches of salt and so much better) and the meat did not meld with the pasta; summed up, it was like a plate of soggy instant noodles with ground meat on top
Alaskan Halibut - nothing bad, but nothing spectacular either
Sauteed Swiss Chard - how can you ruin a simple dish?  easy, over season it so much that the salt burns my tongue

excerpts: Perbacco is probably 1 of my favorite Italian restos in San Francisco.
perbacco.author: Manda Bear B.
perbacco.review:
***************** REVIEW 382 ******************

4.5 Stars

            I'm surprised that I haven't written about this place. I guess must got lost in my previous Yelp account! Perbacco is probably 1 of my favorite Italian restos in San Francisco. It's a stylist spot, excellent service, and the food is consistently great.

           This is 1 of the place that we love to come to the bar for happy hours as well. Alway nice people here and the the host Steve, after all these years, still remember me by name! The new manager Mr. Carron is another wonderful Italian gentleman, that always make you feel so welcomed here, another reason for us to come back for more!

          Their menu got a bit for everyone.  Specialized in the beautifully taste of Piemonte and Liguria food, with a touch of Provence region. Their in house cured salumi and crudo are some of my favorite dishes here. Here are some of the consistent dishes that a MUST ORDER!

- Crudo - preps raw fish, bluefin tuna w/red mandarin, shallots & special sauce - delish!

- Crudo - hamachi seasonal citrus, shaved baby fennel, radish, blood orange oil -1 dish wouldn't be enough for myself!

- Vitello Tonatto - slow roasted veal with lemon & albacore tuna sauce w/capers & arugula - the flavor, the texture, was sublime. 

- Nantucket scallops with baby beets - my brokenhearted girlfriend was so in love all over again by this dish!

- Pan seared Sonoma Foie Gras and sauteed pear - I can never said enough about Foie Gras, 1 of my guilty pleasure dish!

- TAJARIN - Handcut Tagliatelle, 5 hours pork sugo, porcini mushroom - this dish I HAVE to have each time I'm here, ridiculous delicious! 

- Chocolate Souflle Cake with hazelnet Gelato - I don['t eat sweet, but I don't mind a bite from my friend's plate!

           If you can't go to Piemonte for the wines, the Truffles, the men, just come for the food to satisfy your crave, this is as good as it gets! 

Overall: 4.5 stars
For value: 4 stars
For Food: 5 stars
For Service: 5 stars
Ambiance: 4 stars
For Location: Financial District - Valet parking available!

excerpts: Perbacco should be given 10 stars; there are NOT enough stars!
We had drinks (Perbacco, some tequila drink and another froufrou cocktail) and then switched to wine.
Thank you Perbacco for making my 40th Birthday an experience that I will not ever forget!
perbacco.author: Sherie R.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco should be given 10 stars; there are NOT enough stars!

If you want to have a meal that you remember for the rest of your existence; take some very important people in your life and make an event out of it! This IS THE restaurant you want to create lifetime memories at!

Last night my girlfriends and I celebrated my 40th Birthday. Yes, a milestone birthday and I certainly had more than one reason to celebrate!

Upon arrival with my beautiful girlfriends we were greeted very warmly---and the staff knew it was my night. The service was impeccable kind of service where you feel like a VIP from the second you start talking with the Host and Hostess. We got to the table, not to be overlooked by the gorgeous cheese spread that our table was sitting near. 

There was a Birthday card presented to me by the Hostess and we were introduced to Allison AMAZING, INCREDIBLY attentive, smart and funny Hospitality Professional. (SERVER is way too pedestrian for this woman-you have to request her-she is unbelievable)!!! Allison definitely knows the menu and the food. She made some very nice recommendations and is clearly a foodie. I thought she was very emotionally intelligent or a former Actress...she has a high EQ as we learned throughout the evening. I wish she could have joined us, she is that awesome! We ate amazing food, lobster and hearts of palm...poached pear...amazing wine (and that was just for starters). My friend ordered the octopus app for her entree and the brussel sprouts (mind blowing). My other friend ordered the pillows of pasta filled w/goat's cheese and brussel sprouts. Little pillows of heaven with homemade pasta! Yum!

I ordered the papperdelle w/shortrib ragu topped with shredded horseradish. I have to say it was one of the best entrees of my entire life. I would order this again and again. It's perfection. The pasta is generous and beautifully cooked, the short rib is fall apart meat and the sauce w/the horseradish is a perfect marriage of flavors. 

We had drinks (Perbacco, some tequila drink and another froufrou cocktail) and then switched to wine. By the time it was desert and cheese we were done...

The bathrooms are super cool too! Don't drink too much though because you have to trek downstairs to the basement for the bathroom which is kind of a cool set up. The battery of sinks are communal and the toilets are MMWW and then a private bathroom. I liked that concept considering while I was washing my hands the most handsome young man was down there an whoa-I nearly passed out. We ended up talking...and I almost tripped up the stairs (that would have been bad)...we chatted some more and I got a Birthday hug from him...holy crap...what a bonus! He was so hot!!!

Allison knew we were skipping dessert and yet brought a plate that said 'Happy Birthday' in chocolate with some amazing lemon sorbetto and a napoleon that was phenominal...followed up by almond nougat and hazelnut chocolate squares. 

If it were not for Allison our evening would not have been the same. The food was incredible but the service and the feeling of that restaurant was superb. I talked with a man who I think was the owner or manager. Either way-he was delightful. The entire evening will not be forgotten anytime soon. Thank you Perbacco for making my 40th Birthday an experience that I will not ever forget!

excerpts: I hate to give such a renowned and accolades-filled restaurant like Perbacco a poor review.
In fact, there is a wide array of non-Michelin rated restaurants that far surpass Perbacco as well.
perbacco.author: Priya S.
perbacco.review:
I hate to give such a renowned and accolades-filled restaurant like Perbacco a poor review. But unfortunately, we went in with high hopes and came out quite disheartened. 

The service was a tad pretentious but completely understandable given this restaurant's cadence. And the ambiance was quite ordinary with an average dining age group of about 40 - 60 year olds. I suppose it's somewhat classy in a very older and sedentary manner. 

The food was honestly very disappointing. We ordered the butternut squash risotto, fritto misto, short rib pappardelle, side of brussels sprouts and the burnt caramel gelato. I honestly cannot pick my favorite since all of the dishes were equally sub par - I am probably the biggest fan of risottos but this one was simply too sweet, a bit runny and sparse with the cheese. And the pappardelle definitely did not live up to all of the fabulous reviews - it was overpowered with tomato sauce and digressed from any meat based flavor. Eeek. 

But most of all, you can clearly understand how mediocre and unsatisfying the meal was from our reaction to the dessert - we didn't even finish half of it! And it certainty wasn't because we were stuffed. We never waste desserts, EVER. 

So all in all, do yourself a favor and try one of the other Michelin rated SF culinary highlights instead. In fact, there is a wide array of non-Michelin rated restaurants that far surpass Perbacco as well.

perbacco.review:
I needed to find a decent pasta restaurant close to my hotel in the Financial District. A little bit of yelping later, Perbacco seemed to fit the bill.

Just 2.5 blocks from Le Meridien, and located adjacent to Michael Mina, Perbacco was very easy to find. it took them about 5 minutes to get us seated, but as soon as we were, we were greeted by our very friendly waiter. With the exception of a neighboring table seating a drunk mother (accompanied by an embarrassed father and two kids), the service and environment was busy but not overwhelming. slightly louder ambient noise than i expected.

My dining partner ordered the Tortelli di Aragosta (lobster filled pasta), while i (think i) ordered the langaroni. what i mostly remember was that both dishes were delectable. oh, what difference house made fresh pasta makes! it brought back long lost memories of my other pasta dreamventure at Scarpetta.

Our side of fingerling potatoes was glistening in oil, and lacked that slightly crispy outside i always look for in roasted potatoes. it seemed like they didn't leave it in the oven or pan long enough. it was pooling at the bottom of the dish.

for house made pasta in the financial district, this place is actually fairly affordable for a nice sit down restaurant. i'd definitely make an effort to come back again!

Wow, what a bummer experience!  We've been to Perbacco before and had fantastic meals, but last night was just meh.  The salumi plate was spot on as always, and the two salads and brussels sprouts were quite tasty.  On the downside, our octopus salad was totally fishy, and the tajarin was a complete let down.  To echo another reviewer:
"The pasta looked like ramen noodles (the 4 packs for $1 instant ramen kind)..they were pretty curly.  Pork sugo was plentiful though lacked deep flavors, and I didn't see any porcini mushrooms in there!"

On the upside, our server Kyle was super cool, and when we commented on the tajarin they offered to bring us the agnolotti, which was okay but not mind-blowing.  The desserts, however, were totally amazing, so they did send us off on a high note.  However, I doubt I'll return as there are much better places to get a plate of pasta in this city.

excerpts: Perbacco is billed by many food geeks to be one of SF's finest old world style Italian.
perbacco.author: Ken K.
perbacco.review:
I've a mondo soft spot for grissini (breadsticks). 

As a toothless wonder infant (like we all were once), give me a grissini, and I will give you peace, quiet, and cuteness through the roof while dining. Kids these days are so spoiled....they have to be bribed with iFonez, iPad$ with animation movies, just so that parents (or single parents) can go on dates have the kids to be quiet next to them. Not me, I was an easy cheap date....make the breadstick good, and everything else will be in its right place. iGrissini trumps iPad. Nom Nom Nom Yom Yom Bom Bom Bom GaGa GooGoo this breadstick is da shiznit good good! 

But to keep up with the times, you cannot just have great breadstick anymore. 

Perbacco is billed by many food geeks to be one of SF's finest old world style Italian.
Even if they think is Gangnam Style....this place is otherwise really not my style.

Grissini - shaggadelic great. Eat it plain, or dip in some special sauce (the usual olive oil + ground parsley + garlic goodness). I could clean up a whole plate of these easy, with or without salumi.

Butternut squash soup - pretty good, can't go wrong with this one

salad - forgot the name of it, but see the pic. A beautiful sculpture with a few fruits in it that was pure delightful bliss

and then it went south of there (and not south of the boot)

Braised short rib entree - not my order, but had a sample, and I'm of the conclusion that I prefer my short ribs done Asian style (primarily Korean, Vietnamese, or Cantonese/Chinese or Taiwanese). This red wine braised prep is again not my style

Tagliatelle (fresh pasta) with 5 hour pork sugo with wild porcini mushrooms - I purposely skipped the braised short rib paperdelle since a few folks I know ordered it and were not doing the horserider gallop dance afterwards. So I decided to try this pasta dish. Sugo is supposed to be some Italian sauce. Here it is a pork stew mix...and it could possibly change slightly depending on the region, but it's supposed to be like a minced pork (with a puffy texture) simmered with tomato, herbs, amongst other things (supposedly there were porcini mushrooms inside, melted into the mix). Unfortunately there wasn't much in the way of sauce or flavoring...mostly moist minced/ground pork, and fairly one dimensional (mostly a salt profile). No matter how much tossing and mixing of the pork with the pasta, there was a mismatch in general. Grated parmesean didn't improve the dish either. It's perfectly fine if this is the intended approach and execution, but to me this did not work very well. No sauce clinging to the pasta (and still ends up being a salt and pork smear). Something like a Taiwanese style rou zou (stewed minced pork) over brothless noodle, is a lot more robust, in a similar approach (but w/o the tomato). Perhaps a non pasta entree would have been better, but this was a disappointment.

perbacco.author: Augie R.
perbacco.review:
When we first arrived, we were worried Perbacco wasn't going to be our kind of experience.  The place has that typical chichi look of a pretentious, expensive restaurant, and I could not pronounce or recognize half the menu.  (I'm a man of simple tastes!)

Then the food started arriving and wow. Possibly the finest, tastiest meal I've had in San Francisco.

We started with their homemade salumi (cured meats) were flavorful and delicious.  

For dinner, I had the Agnlotti dal Plin (because calling it ravioli would apparently be too pedestrian) and each bite was a taste explosion.  Rich, delicious and recommended. My wife had the quail and raved about it, also.

But perhaps the best was desert.  I honestly may return sometime just to sit at the bar and enjoy the Burnt Caramel Gelato with Vanilla Sea Salt.  It was spectacularly delicious--a completely memorable desert experience.

I still wish the place didn't feel quite so pretentious, but when you serve food this food, you earn the right to have an attitude.

excerpts: I love Perbacco (and the sister restaurant Barbacco) - Perbacco is the facier, sit down/upscale version to the Berbacco, shared table vibe - but both serve delicious Italian.
Perbacco serves one of the best cocktails I've ever tasted - their Fior d'Arancio is out of this world.
The prosecco is lightly sweet and enhanced by the lavender and the orange flavors - you won't regret trying it!
perbacco.author: Jocelin L.
perbacco.review:
I love Perbacco (and the sister restaurant Barbacco) - Perbacco is the facier, sit down/upscale version to the Berbacco, shared table vibe - but both serve delicious Italian.

These are some FiDi gems, and certainly that is their main clientele. Weekday HH and dinner hours get quite crowded.

Perbacco serves one of the best cocktails I've ever tasted - their Fior d'Arancio is out of this world. The prosecco is lightly sweet and enhanced by the lavender and the orange flavors - you won't regret trying it! The pistachio sour is delicious too.

All their pastas are homeruns - but if you HAVE to pick one - try the tajarin.

Stop by for a drink after work (for fancier fare) or make a reservation and enjoy a lovely dinner!

excerpts: Nonetheless, I've eaten at Perbacco.
Perbacco?
perbacco.author: J. S.
perbacco.review:
Before we start, some honesty -- I'm not a foodie and, when dining out, the Financial District is about the last place I'd choose to go.

Nonetheless, I've eaten at Perbacco. Meh.

If you're all about ambiance and presentation and hoity-toity dining with a price tag, eat here. Want to impress a date? A reservation here will clear a path straight to home base. In fact, I'd wager that many of you scoping out the reviews are more interested in these aspects anyway.

The food itself? Well... the dishes are listed on the menu with all of these components with pretty sounding names and they'll look beautiful as they're served to you,... but these simply set the expectation about as high as the price, and so the disappointment hits fast and hard.

I've eaten at places like this before, and I've learned something along the way. A truly excellent restaurant that prepares their items to perfection won't set salt shakers on their tables -- the food won't need it. Perbacco? Salt shakers, every table.

Oh. It's going to sound petty but I'd like to add that the tablecloth (or maybe it was a napkin; I'm not exactly sure) coated my not-for-fine-dining black pants in white lint. The type of lint that gets a good grip and won't let go. Those of you who place high importance on your appearance and fret about it all the time might care so I thought you'd like to know.

Ah, there's nothing quite like the passive-aggressiveness of Yelp reviews, is there?

excerpts: Perbacco definitely lives up to this rule.
I've been here a few times now and consistently the food was amazing and service excellent!
Nice extensive wine list and tasty entrees with seasonal ingredients.
perbacco.author: Linda C.
perbacco.review:
Bread is always a good indicator of the food in most of my experiences. Perbacco definitely lives up to this rule. I've been here a few times now and consistently the food was amazing and service excellent! Nice extensive wine list and tasty entrees with seasonal ingredients. Interior is elegant and it's a great spot for business dinners (and cheaper than MM next door!). 

- Strawberry & Arugula Salad: fresh, delicious vinaigrette made this a great starter
- Sole: slightly crispy, silky smooth, flaky, fresh tomatoes & artichokes, the tomato sauce was good

excerpts: Perbacco is one of the best restaurants in SF , period .
The staff is outstanding from the time you walk into the door , till the time you walk out the door .
I had the beet/white carrot/dill salad , braised beef short-rib, and the lava cake dessert .
Everything was fresh , tasty , and served w care .
Always a pleasure dining here.
perbacco.author: Bryan Y.
perbacco.review: Perbacco is one of the best restaurants in SF , period . The staff is outstanding from the time you walk into the door , till the time you walk out the door . I had the beet/white carrot/dill salad , braised beef short-rib, and the lava cake dessert . Everything was fresh , tasty , and served w care . Always a pleasure dining here.

excerpts: I must say I was somewhat disappointed with Perbacco.
I would be willing to give Perbacco another try, but I would definitely order a different entree.
perbacco.author: Ben M.
perbacco.review:
What I Ate
- salumi misti (house cured meats)
- short ribs ragu
- roasted potatoes

Would I Go Again?
I must say I was somewhat disappointed with Perbacco.  I LOVED everything I ate at Barbacco, so I think I had pretty high expectations for Barbacco's more upscale sister restaurant.  

The house cured meats appetizer was okay.  Most of the meats were pretty good, although I thought the bread with which they were served was dry.

I didn't really like the short ribs ragu.  In fairness, I think the dish was made very well, especially the house-made noodles, but the ragu's flavor just wasn't my favorite.  I also thought the short ribs were tough.

The roasted potatoes were awesome, the star of the meal.  However, if the roasted potatoes are a meal's shining star, then the meal almost certainly didn't live up to expectations.

I would be willing to give Perbacco another try, but I would definitely order a different entree.

excerpts: Cocktail - Perbacco - I decided to go with the cocktail named after the place, I figured that would be a good sign.
perbacco.author: Adam R.
perbacco.review:
Made a reservation here for a business dinner on short notice and was definitely not disappointed.  I liked the atmosphere in was business-nice but welcoming.  

Cocktail - Perbacco - I decided to go with the cocktail named after the place, I figured that would be a good sign.  And While this would have been nice and refreshing in summer, I probably should have just gone with a scotch.

I was eating with two women clients so we didn't end up ordering that much of the menu, but everything was excellent.
Dinner:
Charcuterie - 
Salsiccia Crudo - 
Appetizer - 
Pappardelle - You can also get this as an entree but I think its a great dish to share as an appetizer. 
Entrees
Capicollo Arosto - Roast Duck- Both of them ordered this, and both were very happy.
Cunij - Roast Rabbit Leg - It ws falling off the bone almost like an osobucco, and not the least bit gamey.  I was enamored with the barley risotto which I wish there had been just a little more of.  
Desert
Bonet - Chocolate custard - I'm a chocoholic
Burnt Caramel Gelato

Taste: 5
Presentation: 4
Atmosphere: 5
Service: 4 
Overall: 5

excerpts: Every time I am in the city with a spare hour or two in the early evening, I make a point to stop at Perbacco for one primary reason:
perbacco.author: Gigi G.
perbacco.review:
Every time I am in the city with a spare hour or two in the early evening, I make a point to stop at Perbacco for one primary reason:

They make the best Spritz in the city. 

Its an artful, light and slighty fritzy mix of Aperol (or Campari), Prosecco, soda water and an orange wedge. And their bartenders get it right every time. 

I also love this place for how easy they make it to be a guest: Whether sitting at the bar or at a table, the menu selection has always been wonderful, authentic, well-prepared and perfectly delivered. Service is extraordinary. And the atmosphere is elegant and welcoming. 

The menu is Northern Italian (so for you meat lovers out there - this is your place) Their housed cured salamis and meats are of extremely high quality. 

Appetizers lean towards seafood - try the house-made tuna conserva (if its on the menu) and you'll never look at tuna the same way again. The beef tartare is full of flavor and truffle, and the roasted figs with cheese and hazelnuts salad is completely satisfying. 

As for their pastas: there's not one I wouldn't recommend. But my favorite: the pappardelle with short rib ragu. 

The duck, the beef short ribs and the sea scallops have always delivered. Consistency of food / ingredient quality - combined with top-notch service - is an earmark of this place. 

I could wax on for pages. But I'll end with this: this place is a frequent stop - and a constant nemesis to my waistline.

excerpts: Gave us the choice of Bar Tartine (her favorite) and Perbacco.
We chose the latter for an experience second to none.
perbacco.author: Kalani C.
perbacco.review:
Friend treated us to dinner.  Gave us the choice of Bar Tartine (her favorite) and Perbacco.  We chose the latter for an experience second to none.  We entered a huge restaurant and passed a beautiful bar to their upstairs dinning room.  

We were greeted by a pleasant female waitress that turned out to be the best server EVER!  (See quick tip or read on for specifics).  An amazing thing happens when you have the experience of such a server; you realize how bad your service has been all along.  Ah, Alexandra, where have you been all my dinning life?  I highly recommend being seated in this young woman's section.  Her timing, demeanor and recommendations were all sincere and spot on.

We started with the beet and goat cheese salad, asparagus and Brussels sprouts.  Next, our party of four collectively decided to experience the most of their menu by having the following three pastas:  
TAJARIN - HANDCUT TAGLIATELLE / 5 HOUR PORK SUGO / PORCINI MUSHROOMS

RAVIORA 'D SEIRASS - PASTA FILLED WITH MEYER LEMON SCENTED RICOTTA / ASPARAGUS PASSATO

RABATÒN - TRUFFLE-HERB RICOTTA GNOCCHI / WILD MUSHROOM SUGO

Pastas were perfectly presented and portioned evenly between our four.  Everyone in our party delighted in the bounty and depth of flavors orchestrated.  

For dessert we chose:
RICOTTA MOUSSE / LAMBRUSCO MACERATED STRAWBERRIES

FENNEL DUSTED BOMBOLONI / STAR ANISE SCENTED CHOCOLATE SAUCE & ORANGE MARMELLATA 
(Everyone's absolute favorite; simply divine!)

BURNT CARAMEL GELATO / TAHITIAN VANILLA SEA SALT

A beautiful moment when you know you've experienced something special.  Like a fleeting moment of a lover's caress; or a radio song that slips your mind once the ride is over.  Hurry here while these moments still exist and are realized.  Stellar culinary cuisine & spectacular service awaits.

excerpts: Holy crickets I was stuffed leaving Perbacco.
It was a friends birthday dinner
so there were eight of us at this dinner.
We ordered from every inch of the menu and had a pretty solid wine aficionado working the drink menu.
Dinner was glorious, however when the main course came
I think I may have only eaten two bites
perbacco.author: Jason M.
perbacco.review:
What a feast!! Holy crickets I was stuffed leaving Perbacco. It was a friends birthday dinner so there were eight of us at this dinner. We ordered from every inch of the menu and had a pretty solid wine aficionado working the drink menu. Dinner was glorious, however when the main course came I think I may have only eaten two bites I was so stuffed.

I would suggest seeing how you feel after each dish before moving on to the next part of the menu - they do a great job of getting food out quickly so the lag time isn't worrisome. Also seemed like a great spot to take a date.

Get reservations. Now.

excerpts: Perbacco is one of those safe restaurants that are great for a date, friends outing, or even a business meeting.
It's formal and yet somewhat  romantic, but not stuffy.
perbacco.author: Veronica S.
perbacco.review:
The breadsticks here suck......makes me sad because I love grissini.

BUT, everything else, especially the pastas, are great! Perbacco is one of those safe restaurants that are great for a date, friends outing, or even a business meeting. It's formal and yet somewhat  romantic, but not stuffy. You could get away with dressing casual here.

As far as appetizers go, the burrata cheese & heirloom tomato salad is delicious. As far as the food, I would definitely opt for the pasta selections.  The TAJARIN which feature a delicious pork sugo sauce and tagliatelle is SO SO good. They use dried porcini mushrooms, but  it's great.


The wine line is great, too. Plenty of American & Italian options. 

Taking into account ambiance, food options, wine list, service, & pricing, this place is great for any occasion.

excerpts: Perbacco was completely different than what I expected.
perbacco.author: Hyung L.
perbacco.review:
Had dinner here with some friends of ours and my fiance had been raving about this place for a long time. To be honest I have a negative bias against Italian restaurants. I just don't find most places that interesting. Perbacco was completely different than what I expected.

The food was not your average Italian boring fare. The menu was really interesting and had many items on it that I wanted to try. I think the star was the Papperdelle with braised short rib that my fiance got. Delicious and rich. I got the slow roasted pork shoulder with this killer butternut sqush puree. Omg that puree was so good.

We had several apetizers, the buratta, grilled octopus and heirloom tomatos all excellent. Service was good and the decor is modern but approachable. 

For such a nice place the price point is not bad. Mid 20's for entrees. 

Can't wait for my next trip back.

excerpts:
For whatever reason - Destiny - I have enjoyed the pleasure of so many celebrations whether planned or on the fly at Perbacco.  

Actually, I chose Barbacco for dinner and Perbacco for dessert.
perbacco.author: Kim D.
perbacco.review:
For whatever reason - Destiny - I have enjoyed the pleasure of so many celebrations whether planned or on the fly at Perbacco.  

For my most recent un-birthday, I chose to return to the scene of my 34th and where I've eaten on New Year's Eve more than once.  Actually, I chose Barbacco for dinner and Perbacco for dessert.  

I was with my much-adored former neighbors, and because of Mrs. Computer Geek's appreciation of the absurd and our history, I wanted a very laid-back venue where I could just be my uncensored self, Kimcognito...laugh a lot, and loudly.  It's not demure at all.  

Childrens:  Team Umberto & Staffan reek of truffled excellence.  They also have an exquisite Pastry Chef - Suzanne LaFleur, who seduced me with... 

Wait.  You need to know that this dessert is dangerous-sexy and cannot be consumed solo.  Would I lead you astray, Gentle Yelper?  

Douglas.
Fir.
Panna.
Cotta.
Garnished.
With.
Pignole.
And deep berries that I just recall because of sensory overload.

Hello, marry me - and it was the debut of this dessert.  The mouthfeel was liquid silk and so delicate, you can't believe it.  I know the name sounds a bit odd, but you must order it; don't even think about it.  

Redolent in f the perfect balance of evergreen, woodsy notes of pignole and just-right tart berries, it's edible ecstasy.  

I didn't take any snaps that night, because I'm an epic romantic in the manner of John Donne's sonnets - "T'would [have been]  a profanation of our love.... "  to have taken pictures; you need to experience it for yourself and be completely in the moment, sans distractions.  

Go.  Order.  And after  the edible petite morte  - linger over Suzanne LaFleure's petite fours.

excerpts: We went to Perbacco last night for dinner with out of town guests.
perbacco.author: Jane K.
perbacco.review:
We went to Perbacco last night for dinner with out of town guests. 

The appetizers -- tajarin was okay (they should have asked us for cracked pepper or Parmesan cheese), carne cruda was very bland but nice presentation, big eye tuna was fresh and nicely presented and last, the octopus was chewy and tough.

My dinner was the halibut and it was very bland; the sauce should have been more seasonal. 

My husband had the quail and it was very good but the presentation was unoriginal; one of our guests had the short ribs and that was probably the best plate.

Dessert was ok; not as delicious as the waiter made them sound.

The annoying part of the evening is when they cleared our table without asking us if we were done; and I mean in one clean swoop -- bread, wine and all. 

Also, don't be fooled by the valet -- get there early and find your own parking. We found our car in the exact spot we left it and we were still charged $10 by the restaurant! 

One star goes to the waiter and his welcoming attitude and the second star goes to the sommelier for a great wine recommendation.

excerpts: We're huge fans of Barbacco, and were looking forward to trying Perbacco for a long time.
We'll be sticking with Barbacco in future.
Not that Perbacco was bad, it's just depressingly mediocre by comparison.
perbacco.author: Mike D.
perbacco.review:
We're huge fans of Barbacco, and were looking forward to trying Perbacco for a long time. We'll be sticking with Barbacco in future. Not that Perbacco was bad, it's just depressingly mediocre by comparison.

I ordered the tuna sashimi with melon and chili as an appetizer. What little flavor the dish had was drowned out by the heat of the chili slices. Followed that with a tagliatelle with pork and mushroom sugo. Again, not much flavor. Just salt. Not too much salt, just - not much else.

Atmosphere was too loud for a comfortable conversation. Service was good but not great. Wine list was long, but... would gewürztraminer really be asking too much?

Big disappointment. Not bad, just really really meh. Go to Barbacco instead: you'll get better food for less money with better ambiance and it'll be easier to get a reservation.

excerpts: My step-mother LOVES Perbacco!
She knows I'm a total foodie and is constantly asking if I've tried Perbacco yet.
Perbacco was bustling when we arrived.
Perbacco is much larger than it appears to be from the outside.
Perbacco was very busy for a Tuesday night; hence it was very loud.
As the other reviews stated, this is NOT a date spot.
I'm glad I was able to check #18 off my 7x7 list, but highly doubt I would return to Perbacco.
Although the dishes were well-prepared, none of the dishes stood out b/c they were flavorless.
NEXT!!!
perbacco.author: Cherylynn N.
perbacco.review:
Is it bad to say the best part of the meal was the bread and butter?

My step-mother LOVES Perbacco! She knows I'm a total foodie and is constantly asking if I've tried Perbacco yet. It's been on my list for errm, over a year and the only thing that brought me there was my quest to check #18 Salumi Misti Plate off my 7x7 list...

My gf and I had reservations at 8 PM last night. Perbacco was bustling when we arrived. We waited for 10 minutes while they got our table ready for us.

FOOD:
*Breadsticks and Pesto Dipping Sauce (complimentary): The breadsticks were like ordinary breadsticks you would find at the grocery store. They were a bit too crunchy for my liking. The pesto dipping sauce was very light and fresh, but b/c there wasn't parmesan cheese in it (at least I didn't taste any), so it was bland.  

*Bread and butter: The bread was nice, crusty and had a pillowly soft center. The butter was AMAZINGLY good. It definitely had a higher butterfat content than the standard American butter has; it had a velvety texture than melted into each taste bud.

*Salumi Misti Plate (#18 on 7x7): Don't get me wrong, I love bacon, ham, salami, terrines, galantines, and pates, but I wasn't "wowed" by the Salumi plate. There were about 8 different kinds of house-cured meats, none of which were explained to us, so we didn't know what was what. Other than the pate, all the other meats just tasted like different types of fat and lard. Thank goodness the pickled gherkin, cauliflower and our chianti help balanced out the oiliness. 

*Crudo Hamachi: Three thick slices of hamachi drizzled in oil and sprinkled with shaved fennel, serrano pepper and tangerines. Although the hamachi was buttery, it had a pungent fishy smell to it, which I found to be odd. There was no "fishy" taste which perhaps  the kick from the serrano pepper and the sweet/tartness from the tangerines masked?

*Pappardelle w/ Shortrib Ragu: After seeing rave reviews on YELP, I was so excited to try this dish. But, when I finally got to, it was a let down. The handmade pappardelle was excellent and was cooked to a perfect al-dente and the short-rib was very tender. However, the sauce was a HUGE disappointment b/c it did NOT tie the dish together. I expected it to be somewhat like a marsala; rich and savory sauce packed w/ flavor, but it was nothing like it. It was flavorless, watery and did not adhere to the pappardelle or shortrib

*Slow-Roasted Pork Shoulder w/ Chanterelles and Fingerling Potatoes: The pork shoulder was fork tender, but it was evident that the accompanying sauce was just drizzled on the side as opposed to the pork being braised in it b/c it was flavorless. The chanterelles were tender, as were the potatoes and that's the only good thing I can say about the dish.

DRINKS:
*Hendrick's Tonic: Nice and strong w/ a hint of cucumber flavoring. A very clean and crisp cocktail. 
*2004 Chianti, Riserva, Riserva, Vigna Misciano, Borgo Scopeto (Sangiovese): Smooth, light, fruity notes, and a very acidic aftertaste which helped balanced out the oiliness from some the dishes.

PRICES:
*Apps: $8-12
*Pastas: $11-14 for an appetizer portion and $16-$19 for an entrée portion
*Entrees: $18-$26

SERVICE:
Our waitress was very friendly but not very attentive. It took us about 20 minutes to flag her down before we could order our bottle of wine. However, the busboys always made sure our water was filled. Our food came out in 20-25 minute increments which lead to total dining time of 2 hours.

AMBIANCE/DECOR:
Perbacco is much larger than it appears to be from the outside. The décor is very simple and clean; red brick walls to the left, marble floor, light auburn ceiling, ivory walls, white linens, brown booths and seating and large vases of flowers scattered throughout.

Perbacco was very busy for a Tuesday night; hence it was very loud. As the other reviews stated, this is NOT a date spot. This is more for  pow-wow lunches and business dinners. 

I didn't like the fact that you the bathroom is downstairs and you have to walkdown a long flight of stairs to get there which is challenging with heels after several cocktails/glasses of wine. 

CROWD:
Stuffy mature FIDI crowd dressed in suits and ties.

PARKING: 
Relatively easy street parking after 6 PM. 

I'm glad I was able to check #18 off my 7x7 list, but highly doubt I would return to Perbacco. Although the dishes were well-prepared, none of the dishes stood out b/c they were flavorless. NEXT!!!

excerpts: So often this is an overdone, overlarge, overrich spread, but Perbacco's is light, fluffy, and a perfect starter.
perbacco.author: Jean K.
perbacco.review:
Staffan Terje's cooking continues to evolve. We love how he gently pushes the boundaries of what American diners' conception of what Italian food is. Not everything reaches the heights, but the food is complex and unusual, and therefore worth the extra star.

The four of us shared the salumi misti platter. Mostly ordinary (the bar has been raised so high by so many places these days; we are fortunate in the Bay Area!), but loved the rillette. So often this is an overdone, overlarge, overrich spread, but Perbacco's is light, fluffy, and a perfect starter. Next time I would skip all the other salume and just have this with their lovely housemade breads.

-- Beet salad with mandarin orange: very good
-- Octopus roasted with cranberry beans in tomato concasse: outstanding!
-- Burrata cheese with roasted butternut squash and pears, cress, herb vinaigrette: a Grade B. Chunks were too large, textures too similar, flavors too mild. Squash hadn't caramelized enough to add its usual sweet notes.
-- Ligurian fisherman's soup. Good, but VERY salty
-- Fritto misto. Batter shattered off. Green beans & fennel should have been cut shorter. But the aioli was superb, saved the whole dish.
-- Vitello tonnato. Always superb, and we always order it. Tasted like they sneaked some anchovies into the tonnato sauce, which we heartily approve of. Luscious!

Entrees:
-- Risotto with local porcini mushrooms, caramelized onions, toma della rocca cheese. This was a very different risotto preparation. Compared to the usual pale-colored lemon or chicken risotto, this was more like a "short ribs" of risotto, dark and tangy. Spouose thought it was odd, but I thought it was fabulous.
-- Ravioli filled with roasted butternut squash, toasted hazelnuts, and pomegranate seeds. A beautiful dish, both in looks and taste. Very generous on the half-size serving.
-- Pan-roasted monkfish. Very good, but the veggies (previously always reliable) were al dente, too hard to eat. Had I known this I would have insisted the plate be returned to the kitchen to be redone, but I didn't find out until afterwards.
-- Liberty Farm duck breast, warm salad of brussels sprout leaves, persimmon, dates, pancetta. Very well executed; sauce was more savory than sweet which is what I prefer.

Desserts were good, not great. Service was excellent, this is one of the best-trained waitstaffs in the City.

excerpts: After my first meal at Perbacco
I returned every night because I had to try as many dishes as possible...
its that good.
Highlights were the pappardelle with rabbit ragu, roasted octopus (OMG), dark chocolate-basil bonet for dessert.
The food is SUPERB, and if you're lucky to have a waitress as good as Amber, your meal is elevated to a truly wonderful experience.
She REALLY knows her stuff, knows her wine pairings, made great recommendations and is an absolute delight!!
A memorable meal with memorable service.
Can't wait to return!!
perbacco.author: Ross M.
perbacco.review: In San Francisco recently on business. After my first meal at Perbacco I returned every night because I had to try as many dishes as possible...its that good. Highlights were the pappardelle with rabbit ragu, roasted octopus (OMG), dark chocolate-basil bonet for dessert. The food is SUPERB, and if you're lucky to have a waitress as good as Amber, your meal is elevated to a truly wonderful experience. She REALLY knows her stuff, knows her wine pairings, made great recommendations and is an absolute delight!! A memorable meal with memorable service. Can't wait to return!!

excerpts: I went to Perbacco last night with a group of friends to celebrate my birthday.
The restaurant is very classy and the decor is simple yet elegant.
If you're looking for a great meal that is reasonably priced for the quality of food and service, Perbacco is a solid restaurant.
perbacco.author: Akash R.
perbacco.review:
I went to Perbacco last night with a group of friends to celebrate my birthday.  The restaurant is very classy and the decor is simple yet elegant.  Parking is also very easy in this part of town at nighttime.  

Upon our arrival, my friend secretly told the hostess that it was my birthday.  Before we got to our table, they put a birthday card at my seat!  Very thoughtful.

The food was presented well.  I'm not much of a foodie, but my friends definitely are and we all loved our meal.  I had the halibut and my friends ordered the rabbit, pork shoulder and pasta.  They were all delicious.  The meat was not overcooked and each dish had a distinct flavor.  I had the mushroom soup as well and that was very tasty.  Make sure you try the sunchokes and brussel sprouts as well.  Oh, and the breadsticks!  We couldn't stop eating them!

The staff was very attentive and did not miss a beat.  5 star experience all around.  For dessert, we had the white chocolate mousse and enjoyed that as well.  Since it was my birthday, they brought out macademia nut meringue cookies as a special treat.  Thank you!

If you're looking for a great meal that is reasonably priced for the quality of food and service, Perbacco is a solid restaurant.

excerpts: If you're looking forward to seal the deal with your next client, look no further than Perbacco.
Like-minded Fidi people flock to this lunch spot
perbacco.author: Janice C.
perbacco.review:
Power lunch.

If you're looking forward to seal the deal with your next client, look no further than Perbacco. Like-minded Fidi people flock to this lunch spot so I was glad that I made a reservation, because I was wrong to think that it would be less busy with the nasty rainy weather we have. 

Upon getting seated, water and breadsticks with pesto sauce were provided. You can skip the breadsticks, a bit too crunchy, but don't worry you also get a piece of thick focaccia bread with butter.

I had to order the salumi misti plate, which is #18 on the Big Eat SF list. We had to motion for the waiter to come over and tell us what each item is. He took the time explaining each meat but I could barely hear him since the noise level in here was pretty high. There were 5 different house cured salumi and 2 kinds of pate on the plate. I really liked the salumi di coto with its noticeable dots of fat. The prosciutto cured in red wine was definitely the saltiest of all, so I put some quince jelly to tone it down. The cornichons were a fave of my BFF! Both of us didn't want to touch the lardo because it just looked unappetizing.

Absolutely get the Rabaton, it's a truffled-herb gnocchi with roasted mushroom sugo. He kept raving about these soft pillows! This dish is a good choice for vegetarians as it is very filling.

I ordered the Tajarin. Imagine hand-cut tagliatelle, pork sugo cooked for 5 hours crowned with just the right amount of parmigiano reggiano.  A simple dish but incredibly good. 

Oh, dessert. 

The pistachio panna cotta with pomegranate gelatina and pistachio cookies were more than welcome in my mouth.  Although this panna cotta was too soft set for my liking, we still finished the whole thing.

Service was professional but could be more friendlier next time.  It was a packed house so that's understandable. A fine meal shared with a good friend at a solid restaurant, my only regret is that I had to go to work after.

excerpts: The cilantro sauce was so good we asked for extra to have with our meal, and because of Perbacco's awesome service, got more in no time.
perbacco.author: Neeharika B.
perbacco.review:
SERVICE:
5 stars (I'd give 7, if I could)
The phenomenal service really added to my experience here. The staff is attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. I'm vegetarian and they really worked with me to find things on the menu that worked or could be made vegetarian. You'll see that I didn't LOVE the food below, but the service was so good, that I'd consider going back JUST for the service.

AMBIANCE:
The crowd seemed like a bunch of businessmen / older individuals / couples--wasn't very diverse. The mood was on the formal side. Really good for a dinner w/ a significant other's parents or something. Formal, but not too formal, excellent service, and decent food.

FOOD:
3 stars
(out of clarity--5's are rare for me--things that blow me away, 4 is really good--things i'd go back and eat more of, 3 is okay--a decent meal that one should try but that i wouldn't really go back for, 2 is okay--a meal that i won't really remember or recommend others to try, 1 is bad)

We were served some breadsticks with delicious cilantro sauce as soon as we got there (really nice because a couple of us arrived hungry and needed that to keep us smiling til we got our meals.) The cilantro sauce was so good we asked for extra to have with our meal, and because of Perbacco's awesome service, got more in no time. 

We ordered the fig salad, which was pretty good. The cheese on the dish was rather strong, so if that isn't your cup of tea, beware. We also to the Rabaton, and two of us didn't like it very much. It was definitely the right texture (melt-in-your-mouth texture) but none of us ended up being huge fans of the flavor (may be a personal thing). We got the fingerling potatoes (made vegetarian) and they weren't too special. For dessert we got panforte and panna cotta. The panforte was reasonably good but did not blow us away and the panna cotta was DELICIOUS and great texture. Oh and the bread that came with the entrees was good.

PRICES:
Reasonable, actually! I think it was quite affordable for what it was. When I walked in, I expected each entree to be much more expensive (just given the formal decor).

excerpts: Sorry, Perbacco.
I disagree.
perbacco.author: Sandy T.
perbacco.review:
I'm kicking myself for not going next door to Michael Mina's because I had a choice.

Everything was just okay.  Service was great.  Octopus was overcooked.  Food was good but unmemorable.  I guess my favorite part of the meal was the "ugly but good" cookies and the breadsticks.  

I hate to give this place such a bland review, but nothing compels me to come back here.  Sorry, Perbacco.  I disagree.  Italian food should be rich, charming, evocative, sensuous, and make you want to lick the plate and not care if sauce stains your favorite shirt. 

My dinner was like that summer of '96 where you did.....  Remember? Oh wait, I don't even remember.

excerpts: I decided to eat at Perbacco on my last night in SF.
I thought it was going to have a quiet peaceful dinner.
Sorry Perbacco, you disappointed me.
perbacco.author: Twig T.
perbacco.review:
I decided to eat at Perbacco on my last night in SF. I thought it was going to have a quiet peaceful dinner.  The noise level in the restaurant is kind of unbearable.

They were nice enough to move me to a more quiet area.  
I ordered the:
Mushroom soup (it was good)
Seared Sea Scallops with Matsutake Mushroom and Salsify Ragout, Leeks, crumbled Marazapane (the scallops were kinda sandy... ICK!)

The servers were great, but I don't think I'd return back :( 
Sorry Perbacco, you disappointed me.

excerpts: You need to go in and see Lisa at Perbacco.
You won't be disappointed.
perbacco.author: Tom S.
perbacco.review: The best cocktails I have had anywhere in the city. Their mixologist Lisa is incredible. Her cocktails are so flavorful and not watered-down they really let you know what a cocktail should be. You need to go in and see Lisa at Perbacco. You won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Perbacco is one of those places that the food is so good, you get flashbacks of your meal and think of those memories fondly.
perbacco.author: Rebekah T.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is one of those places that the food is so good, you get flashbacks of your meal and think of those memories fondly. 

This is the type of place we bring clients to because it is consistently good, nice atmosphere and not too loud. I am happy to go anytime. 

I usually get a salad, I love the Roasted Bartlett Pear or they have a great Heirloom Tomato Salad (Seasonally) and either the Fish or the Steak depending on my mood. Either choice is usually fantastic. The bread is great too, but I try not to ruin my appetite. There is so much to enjoy here.

excerpts: I'm sure you're thinking, how could I give Perbacco 3 stars?
In all honesty it probably deserves 4 stars but
when I compare it against its sister Barbacco
a few doors down
Perbacco and Barbacco are completely different restaurants.
Different vibes, different food (same style).
Perbacco is definitely a more upscale, fine dining atmosphere.
The food was, indeed, delicious
perbacco.author: Vivi T.
perbacco.review:
I'm sure you're thinking, how could I give Perbacco 3 stars? In all honesty it probably deserves 4 stars but when I compare it against its sister Barbacco a few doors down ... it's no comparison!

Perbacco and Barbacco are completely different restaurants. Different vibes, different food (same style). Perbacco is definitely a more upscale, fine dining atmosphere. The food was, indeed, delicious but it does lack the homeyness and punch that you get from Barbacco.

Order the Salumi Misti - it's just as good as everyone says. We also had the burrata, which is on everyone's menu these days, but was delicious.

We also had one of the evening's risotto specials - good but it sounds like there were other standouts on the menu. Scallops were perfection.

Overall, a lovely fine-dining restaurant. Great service, good food. I just prefer the Barbacco for a little more personality.

excerpts: In the heart of the financial district on California, you'll find Perbacco.
You enter and are greeted by a bar and seating area.
perbacco.author: Brad B.
perbacco.review:
In the heart of the financial district on California, you'll find Perbacco.  You enter and are greeted by a bar and seating area.  Down the hall from the bar, the restaurant opens into a clean, slick room with brick walls and long foot long mirrors stretching horizontally across the wall above the seats and just below the ceiling.

The food was generally quite good, though not outstanding.  The highlights for me were the brussel sprout sides and the chocolate bonet.  On the down side, the pork shoulder entre was a bit undercooked.  Overall somewhere between 3-4 stars, but I'll go with four.

excerpts: There was a birthday card awaiting the guest of honor from the Perbacco staff when we were seated.
perbacco.author: Tony K.
perbacco.review:
We had party of seven for a birthday, got the private table near the kitchen. We enjoyed excellent food and terrific service. There was a birthday card awaiting the guest of honor from the Perbacco staff when we were seated. That was a nice touch. 

For food, we enjoyed:

Appetizers: Salumi Misti (tasty, good for a group), pesce crudo (recommended, favorite appetizer! Light, refreshing, great combo of flavors), and fritto misto of rock shrimp (fried dish; taste the fried lemon together with the shrimp for a nice flavor)

Pasta course: we did the BIS (two tastings of pasta for the table), including the very nice pappardelle 

Main course: the capicollo arrosto (slow-roasted pork shoulder) was beautiful but did not quite get there on flavor for me; the beef short rib stracotto was better; the scallops looked delicious but I didn't get to try them.

I'd go back for the service, pesce crudo, salumi misti, some pasta tastings, and a bottle of the 2006 Confini, Lis Neris.

excerpts: I came to Perbacco again and my experience was perfect.
Every dish we had was great (we took suggestions from the waiter...
if you don't know what to get, the waiters there seem to really know the menu, so don't be afraid to ask for a suggestion).
My favorite dish was the pappardelle.
Really nothing to complain about.
Perbacco is a wonderful restaurant with a great ambiance and delicious food that is totally worth the price (and it's not unreasonable by any means).
Can't wait to go back!
perbacco.author: Alison B.
perbacco.review:
Came here for lunch... nice place (seemed more like a dinner place honestly, but I don't mind), staff was friendly. I got the ravioli with wine and short rib... I loved the flavor and you can tell that they make the pasta themselves. I thought the portion size/food quality/service/price was all in sync. 

I think this is a good place to go when you want a nice italian lunch in the area. I still need to go back and get that salumi dish...

EDIT 5/25/2012:

I came to Perbacco again and my experience was perfect. Every dish we had was great (we took suggestions from the waiter... if you don't know what to get, the waiters there seem to really know the menu, so don't be afraid to ask for a suggestion). My favorite dish was the pappardelle. Really nothing to complain about. Perbacco is a wonderful restaurant with a great ambiance and delicious food that is totally worth the price (and it's not unreasonable by any means). Can't wait to go back!

excerpts: I'd pick Barbacco for sure over Perbacco.
Older crowd here.
perbacco.author: Jeannie L.
perbacco.review:
I've come here a bunch of times but never remember to review it. Must say something. 

It's ok. I like their sister restaurant next door much better, Barbacco. 

The food is really good though but for some reason, I'm not the biggest fan.

I have had their hanger steak, it melts in your mouth. Their veal appetizer is truly delicious. Their smoked salmon salad was simple and filling. I loved their side brussel sprouts though! 

For some reason, after I left this restaurant this time, I felt like food was all over me. Might be the low ceilings and the fat/oil just clings to you. Gross. 

I'd pick Barbacco for sure over Perbacco. Older crowd here.

excerpts: Everyone talks about the Salumi dish at Perbacco, so even though I am not a fan of cured meats I had to try it.
My favorite 2 dishes from Perbacco are their brown butter brussel sprouts and the black and white chocolate mousse!
I never liked brussel sprouts until I tried it here!
perbacco.author: Cindy L.
perbacco.review:
Everyone talks about the Salumi dish at Perbacco, so even though I am not a fan of cured meats I had to try it. I wasn't surprised I wasn't a fan of eating meats that looked raw, but luckily my bf loved it. 

The pappardelle with short rib ragu had a very strong wine taste to it, but I really liked the pasta. I did not enjoy the pasta filled with short rib and mushroom ...so definitely would never order that again. The rabbit was cooked pretty well.

My favorite 2 dishes from Perbacco are their brown butter brussel sprouts and the black and white chocolate mousse! I never liked brussel sprouts until I tried it here!

excerpts: Although Perbacco doesn't offer senior discounts to rival the 25% off coffee special at McDonalds or the free small drink (no refills) at KFC, I agreed to eat here for my initial senior citizen dining foray.
What a treat.
Go to Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Mark B.
perbacco.review:
We had a fantastic, to die for dinner for my 55th birthday.  Although Perbacco doesn't offer senior discounts to rival the 25% off coffee special at McDonalds or the free small drink (no refills) at KFC, I agreed to eat here for my initial senior citizen dining foray.  What a treat.  Here's what to order:

Appetizers
Raviolo
Roasted Porcini Mushroom yada yada yada
Burratta cheese

The Burratta was beyond perfection if there is such a thing.  I guess it's kind of like giving 150% effort.

Main Courses
Langaroli - among top 3 pasta dishes of all time (that would be my all time since I can't account for ones that I haven't eaten - yes I know that many yelpers don't share my sentiment on this score and know when they've eaten something that's top 5 in the world.  Remember, I'm the one who got excited about the senior coffee discount at McDonalds.)

Rabaton (you can read their menu online for a translation)

Pappardelle

Even if it's just the two of you, order all three and take the leftovers home.

Dessert
I love ice cream and I've attempted to sample the best ice cream wherever I go.

Both my daughter and I think we just had the greatest ice cream in the world (in other words, I'm taking back what I said earlier in the Langaroli section of my review).  GET THE STRAWBERRY GELATO.  I'm not sure that it's even fair to call in Gelato because whatever it really was was otherworldly (my high school English teacher is turning over in her grave).

Normally, I won't give 5 stars to a place that I've only visited once but I'm making an exception tonight.  

And as if I haven't already written enough, the waitress was spectacular - a blond Italian 20-something woman who was everything you could possibly want in a server and more (perfect food and wine recommendations, personality, patience)  I left my largest % tip ever and wish I had given her more.  Go to Perbacco.

excerpts:
This year we decided to celebrate at Perbacco. 
And Perbacco delivered the goods with humor, thoroughly professional service, delicious food and wine, and thoughtful little extras. 

We enjoyed every minute at Perbacco. 

And Perbacco comes in at a very close second place for a luxury dining experience.
perbacco.author: Tom S.
perbacco.review:
Bambi makes a BIG deal about our wedding anniversary celebration, even when it's just she and me at the party. This year we decided to celebrate at Perbacco. Our expectations for a fine and fabulous dinner were high. 

And Perbacco delivered the goods with humor, thoroughly professional service, delicious food and wine, and thoughtful little extras. 

We spent 3.5 hours at table. We got an upstairs booth at the glass wall. We enjoyed every minute at Perbacco. 

My best all time SF restaurant experience has been Gary Danko. And Perbacco comes in at a very close second place for a luxury dining experience. 

Fantastic.

excerpts: I would rather have salty any day but dessert at Perbacco is close to changing my mind.
ORDER the ugly cookies.
They look really weird but get them.
TRUST ME unless you are allergic to hazelnuts or don't like hazelnuts.
I am pretty sure I am allergic to ugly things but these cookies are the exception.
I am pretty sure I would do some crazy things for the recipe.
They were the perfect end to the meal.
We also had the almond cake and it is good but the cookies were out of this world.
perbacco.author: Eve C.
perbacco.review:
I came here with another foodie for her birthday and I definitely got a gold star for choosing it. 

Get the salumi misti plate, there are at least 7 different kinds of salumi. When the waiter brings the plate, they will explain to you what each kind is and honestly unless you have that good of a memory, you will forget what you are eating. I like most of them except the ones that were softer in texture...kind of reminded me of raw hamburger meat. But still get the plate. 

For dinner we did the tasting of the 2 different kind of pasta, the Langaroli Al Brasato and then Agnolotti Al Coniglio (rabbit). Both of us liked the Agnolotti  more but both were melt in your mouth goodness. 

Dessert was probably the best and I am NOT a dessert person. I would rather have salty any day but dessert at Perbacco is close to changing my mind. ORDER the ugly cookies. They look really weird but get them. TRUST ME unless you are allergic to hazelnuts or don't like hazelnuts. I am pretty sure I am allergic to ugly things but these cookies are the exception. I am pretty sure I would do some crazy things for the recipe. They were the perfect end to the meal. We also had the almond cake and it is good but the cookies were out of this world.

excerpts: Perbacco is pretty YUM!
Love having a glass of wine and some lasagna.
The ambiance is good, service is good and food is good.
Overall, this place is pretty good.
haha...
I'll be back.
perbacco.author: Noneya B.
perbacco.review: Perbacco is pretty YUM! Love having a glass of wine and some lasagna. The ambiance is good, service is good and food is good. Overall, this place is pretty good. haha... I'll be back.

excerpts: We were delighted to find out that Perbacco annually hosts a Passover dinner twice during the week long holiday.
What a treat!
We started out with matzoh and haroset ("paste" comprised of apples and nuts) and it was fab.
Next they brought us a large spread of roasted vegetables...
asparagus, carrots peppers stuffed with mushrooms, and fried artichokes - delish.
After that we got to choose between a mushroom soup and a chicken dumpling soup.
We opted for the chicken soup and polished it off in no time.
For our entrees we indulged in a lamb stew lamb and chicken in a citrus sauce.
They were both good - we didn't have any leftovers.
Aside from the kosher for passover food being surprisingly delicious (kosher for passover food is often bland)
the service was great and all the staff members were very pleasant.
Another plus is that they offer valet parking.
We will DEFINITELY return for next year's passover dinner.
