excerpts: First, I appreciate the fact that restaurants will decant wine for guests when appropriate, but for some reason Perbacco decided to buy decanters that are very pretty but extremely hard to use (the ones with the super wide base).
The poor table next to us got their wine spilled all over the table and into their food as the waitress tried to get the last wine out of the decanter.
Secondly, when I ask the waitress what her favorite dish is I kind of expect her to know how its cooked.
Ours didn't, she just knew to pick the priciest thing on the menu.
I have been a waiter
perbacco.author: Pete M.
perbacco.review:
Went there last week for dinner and was pleased, though not overly impressed.  The service was fairly good, though there were a few things that stood out.  First, I appreciate the fact that restaurants will decant wine for guests when appropriate, but for some reason Perbacco decided to buy decanters that are very pretty but extremely hard to use (the ones with the super wide base). The poor table next to us got their wine spilled all over the table and into their food as the waitress tried to get the last wine out of the decanter.  Secondly, when I ask the waitress what her favorite dish is I kind of expect her to know how its cooked.  Ours didn't, she just knew to pick the priciest thing on the menu.  I have been a waiter and I know the game, but if your going to pick the priciest thing as your "favorite"  (I should have said favorite thing to eat, not sell) you should know how to describe it in an appealing way.

As far as the food goes, the first two courses were great (hamachi crudo and blood orange salad first, then truffle gnocchi in mushroom brodo) but the main courses were far short of expectations.  The duck was a huge portion but chewy and the rabbit was very dry.  

If you go, I suggest sticking with the pasta dishes which are quite good and available in app or entree sizes.  And don't let them decant your wine!

excerpts: Let me tell you, Perbacco definitely knows how to take care of special occasions.
and the food at Perbacco tasted just as good as everything looked!
We started off with the salumi misti which had a nice variety of salami.
And followed with the raviloi--my favorite!!
Cooked inside the ravioli, was spinach and ricotta and egg yolk...
ahh soo good!!!!
The egg yolk really made it that much better!
And for our main dish, we had short ribs which had so much flavor and were also very, very tender.
For dessert, we decided to stick to something light--lemon sorbet.
It was a nice change to our meal, but it was a bit too sour.
However, when we mixed it with the lady fingers (I think), it sort of neutralized the sourness.
But, despite the taste, the presentation of sorbet was so cute...
the chef had written "Happy anniversary" in chocolate on the platter...nice way to end our meal!
perbacco.author: Lisa Marie R.
perbacco.review:
Pros: Yummy food, price, ambiance, customer service
Cons: I don't even know!

Due to all the great reviews, my boyfriend and I decided to eat here for our mini anniversary dinner.  Lucky for us, we were able to make reservations only a few hours before.  Don't get me wrong, it's not that the restaurant was empty that night...in fact, it was completely filled...and the restaurant is also a lot bigger than it looks!  

The interior of the restaurant is a nice mix of old and new.  The exposed brick walls and painted pipes on the ceiling opposite the clean light wood walls and glass and mirror touches all compliment each other well.  From the street, the restaurant looks small and narrow, however, it actually goes back a long way and widens towards the middle of the restaurant.  Suprise, surprise!

Let me tell you, Perbacco definitely knows how to take care of special occasions.  The minute we walked in, we were greeted by the hostess and were wished a happy anniversary--nice!  and immediately walked to our table, which was a "special" corner booth--double nice!  and placed on our table was an anniversary card--nice, again!

I'm not some type of professional food critic...in fact, it's hard for me to even describe the difference between sweet and sour...but I can tell when food tastes good or not...and the food at Perbacco tasted just as good as everything looked!  We started off with the salumi misti which had a nice variety of salami.  And followed with the raviloi--my favorite!!  Cooked inside the ravioli, was spinach and ricotta and egg yolk...ahh soo good!!!!  The egg yolk really made it that much better!  And for our main dish, we had short ribs which had so much flavor and were also very, very tender.  For dessert, we decided to stick to something light--lemon sorbet.  It was a nice change to our meal, but it was a bit too sour.  However, when we mixed it with the lady fingers (I think), it sort of neutralized the sourness.  But, despite the taste, the presentation of sorbet was so cute...the chef had written "Happy anniversary" in chocolate on the platter...nice way to end our meal!  :)

All in all...great experience with good food.  Just a couple spaces down is the sister restaurant, Barbacco...I cant' wait to try it one day!

excerpts: But my fiancée and I were quite pleased with Perbacco.
All the courses were good and the pasta was exceptional.
Next time I would probably get a full order of pasta instead of a meat entree.
perbacco.author: Greg H.
perbacco.review:
I have to admit I was a little nervous after seeing some lukewarm Yelp reviews.  But my fiancée and I were quite pleased with Perbacco.  All the courses were good and the pasta was exceptional.  Next time I would probably get a full order of pasta instead of a meat entree.  I found the food prices to be reasonable compared to similar restaurants, but maybe the wine markups make up for it.  

At least when we went (Saturday night), the restaurant seemed to attract a slightly older and dressier crowd, so guys should wear a nice jacket.

excerpts: I was just surprisingly contacted by Perbacco about my last visit.
I had responded with a little more detail than I had included on this rating.
The outreach is very much appreciated and has proved to me that Perbacco strives to keep the patrons absolutely pleased.
Many thanks U.G.
I'm adding on another star for the exceptional customer service in the effort to make contact with their customers
perbacco.author: Stephanie D.
perbacco.review:
UPDATE:  I was just surprisingly contacted by Perbacco about my last visit.  I had responded with a little more detail than I had included on this rating.  The outreach is very much appreciated and has proved to me that Perbacco strives to keep the patrons absolutely pleased.  Many thanks U.G.  I'm adding on another star for the exceptional customer service in the effort to make contact with their customers (Wish I could add on more from this pleasant experience).   

Attractive interior decor, Great dishes & not the friendliest staff (one person & if you do think about it everyone has a bad day here and there) but heck sadly it's common around the Financial Dist.  Still doesn't take away from the wonderful selections the menu has to offer for lunch and dinner.  Risotto is delish here.  The menu is nicely thought out, a nice change for this area.  Prices are what is expected but I think worth it.

excerpts: Perbacco is really one of my top fav's in the city, despite the volume that is almost deafening, (this is not a restaurant you go to talk in), the food and service are just so perfect that I can deal with the harshly modern decor and noise.
Wow" is what perbacco translates to, and "wow" is how you feel when you walk in.
The soaring ceilings, marble topped bar and 1912 brick wall give a feeling of awe.
The crowd, depending on lunch or dinner, ranges from the business power lunchers to the swanky SF elite that come here to be seen.
Personally, I love sitting at the bar, letting Scott (the amazing bar tender) surprise me with wonderful drinks, food and conversation.
However, when I come here and want a more private dining experience, I always request the upstairs.
perbacco.author: Bianca L.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is really one of my top fav's in the city, despite the volume that is almost deafening, (this is not a restaurant you go to talk in), the food and service are just so perfect that I can deal with the harshly modern decor and noise.

The Scene
"Wow" is what perbacco translates to, and "wow" is how you feel when you walk in. The soaring ceilings, marble topped bar and 1912 brick wall give a feeling of awe. The crowd, depending on lunch or dinner, ranges from the business power lunchers to the swanky SF elite that come here to be seen. Personally, I love sitting at the bar, letting Scott (the amazing bar tender) surprise me with wonderful drinks, food and conversation.However, when I come here and want a more private dining experience, I always request the upstairs. It is far more intimate, and the noise is muffled down to a low roar.

The Food
The menu changes daily, and as I do in most trusted restaurants, I let the server suggest everything...although certain staples are always sought after....the duck!
The bread and breadsticks with the pesto dip...just fabulous
Tasting of Salame/Salumi Misit-just order, the fruit compot and pate, YUM!
Octopus in Zimino-cooked to perfection, not chewy at all, (a fear a have with octopus).
Burrata Cheese-I order this anywhere I see it. The peppers give it a unique taste which I enjoyed.
Brandacujun-ligurian salt cod...yes, I know...this is a matter of taste, but I  loved it...not too salty
Roasted Pears-cheese,honey,pear...could life get better?

Truffle her gnocchi-I love truffles and gnocchi, these were to die for. Light, fluffy, creamy and then the truffle flavor....
Liberty Farms Duck Breast-I have an addiction to duck, so needless to say, I always order it. From chestnut polenta to roasted pears, the duck here is always rare, flavorlicious and never fatty

Olive Oil Panna Cotta-delicious, always served with a different seasonal fruit....yummy

****Note***Perbacco is pricey! Well worth every penny, but not friendly to the wallet. For two, with cocktails and wine, be prepared for $200+

excerpts: I visited Perbacco as a part of a release celebration lunch with 38 other people and had an excellent experience.
The interior is very classy with stylish contemporary decorations.
perbacco.author: Charles B.
perbacco.review:
I visited Perbacco as a part of a release celebration lunch with 38 other people and had an excellent experience. The interior is very classy with stylish contemporary decorations. The menu was small and fixed, but each item was well combined. 

The appetizers and salad were meant to be shared around the table with a separate individual entree and shared desserts. Each course was fresh and flavorful. I was very impressed with the smoothness of the service and lack of any delays for such a large party.  Very well organized! My sweet-tooth loved the runny chocolate cake. The only downside is the relatively high price.

excerpts: Perbacco is wonderful for so many reasons.
perbacco.author: Leslie A.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is wonderful for so many reasons.

1) The salumi; try each and every one.

2) No corkage fee if you order an additional bottle.

3) HAMACHI CRUDO 

4) Lively atmosphere for work, pleasure, and hunger.

excerpts: Ah, Perbacco...

What Can I Say?
Perbacco =
For Bacchus translated.
Brilliant.
One could say that I Live my Life Perbacco...
Corny, but True.
I've been here three times already
and I really like Perbacco a lot.
When we sat down, there was a bday card from Perbacco as well as a bottle of MV Laurent-Perrier Rose Brut from Champagne,
France waiting for us chilled.
Highly Recommend.
(Note:
The Champagne was a call ahead present from her boy in NJ)
After we were sat, the Restaurant Manager came to our table to greet her happy birthday and to thank us for choosing Perbacco for her celebration...
Perbacco has quite an extensive Wine List.
We enlisted the help of the Sommelier to help us choose a good wine to go with our Dinner and he recommended us a fabulous Chardonnay called Karia by Stag's Leap Cellars.
It was Lovely.
Perbacco is known for their Salumi, which they cure themselves and for their Pastas which they also make themselves.
We were a party of 4 lovely ladies and we decided to do the Dinner Family Style.
perbacco.author: Rose C R.
perbacco.review:
Ah, Perbacco...  What Can I Say?
Perbacco = For Bacchus translated.  Brilliant.
One could say that I Live my Life Perbacco...  Corny, but True.
I've been here three times already and I really like Perbacco a lot.
Once for Happy Hour, another time for a Client Lunch and now Dinner.

I'm gonna break it down for the Dinner...
Went last Friday night for my girlfriend, JZ's Bday Dinner and we were extremely impressed by the Service and the Food.  
When we sat down, there was a bday card from Perbacco as well as a bottle of MV Laurent-Perrier Rose Brut from Champagne, France waiting for us chilled.  Highly Recommend.  (Note: The Champagne was a call ahead present from her boy in NJ)  After we were sat, the Restaurant Manager came to our table to greet her happy birthday and to thank us for choosing Perbacco for her celebration...  Nice.

Perbacco has quite an extensive Wine List.  We enlisted the help of the Sommelier to help us choose a good wine to go with our Dinner and he recommended us a fabulous Chardonnay called Karia by Stag's Leap Cellars.  It was Lovely.  So lovely that we had two bottles of it...

The Food:
We started off with the Tasting of Salame and the Heirloom Tomato Salad prepared with Sea Salt, Olive Oil, Manodori Balsamico and Fresh Basil.  It was a perfect combination and a great start.  Perbacco is known for their Salumi, which they cure themselves and for their Pastas which they also make themselves.
We were a party of 4 lovely ladies and we decided to do the Dinner Family Style.  So we shared 2 Pasta Entrees and 2 Meat Dishes.

For the Pasta, we had the Agnolloti filled with Roasted Veal and Savoy Cabbage.  This was my Favorite, as well as an overall Ladies pick.  Our second Pasta Dish was the Pappardelle in a Braised Short Rib Ragu and we thought that was delicious as well.

For our Mains, we had the King Salmon with Roasted Padrone Peppers, Artichoke Passato & Melted Cherry Tomatoes.  Sounds pretty fancy, huh?  Our other Entree was the Grilled Lamb Sirloin Tagliata with a Summer Bean Salad & MInt Salsa Verde.  Both were good, but I think the Pastas were more of the Star.

For Dessert:
They brought us a Warm Pistachio Cake with a Cherry Compote and Vanilla-Thyme Syrup, which was Divine.  It even had Happy Birthday written on it in Chocolate Sauce.  We also had the Gelati Misti, which was a Trio of the following Flavors - Chocolate/Vanilla & Caramel with Sea Salt and a Vanilla Strawberry Twirl.  All Delish...

Here's the Breakdown:
-Definitely Try - The Salumis & The Pastas.  It's what their known for so don't sleep on 'em.
-Service was Exceptional. 

Additional Info from My Prior Experiences:
-I tried their Burrata, which I thought did not touch the Burrata at A16.
-Had the Salumi Misti which was the Chef's Selection, which I highly recommend.  We do this sort of thing for Sushi, why not Salumi?
-Next time I want to try some of their Crudos.  Sounds like a perfect little plan for Happy Hour, no?

Mangia, People... Mangia!

excerpts: My husband and I were vacationing in San Francisco for our anniversary, and we dined at Perbacco to celebrate.
Even though we were out-of-towners and first-timers, they treated us like special guests.
They had a "Happy Anniversary" card ready for us when we checked in, and they prepared us a delicious dessert specially adorned for the occasion.
Plus, the food was outstanding!
I highly recommend Perbacco for a special evening out.
Looks like it has a lively after work happy hour crowd as well.
Enjoy!
perbacco.author: Cat S.
perbacco.review: My husband and I were vacationing in San Francisco for our anniversary, and we dined at Perbacco to celebrate. Even though we were out-of-towners and first-timers, they treated us like special guests. They had a "Happy Anniversary" card ready for us when we checked in, and they prepared us a delicious dessert specially adorned for the occasion. Plus, the food was outstanding! I highly recommend Perbacco for a special evening out. Looks like it has a lively after work happy hour crowd as well. Enjoy!

excerpts: Perbacco is popular for a reason, make sure to get reservations and seating in the back.
perbacco.author: Steve S.
perbacco.review:
Great food and service. Only thing I would change is adding some sort of wall coverings to dampen the sound. It's hard to have a conversation here during lunch or dinner with sounds bouncing from all directions.

Perbacco is popular for a reason, make sure to get reservations and seating in the back.

excerpts: And that's the reason why I hope to bump up this rating the next time I feel like going to Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Herb C.
perbacco.review:
I want to give more to this new restaurant but it might have to come at a later time.  Had a B-day dinner here with the folks a couple nights ago and overall it was average.   

First of all, if there is a lot of people at the bar, as it was that night, the noise just resonates down into the dining area.   Second of all, if I ask the waitress what would she get if deciding between the quail and the pan roasted chicken, give me some ideas on the two.  Don't just ask me if I like mushrooms and since the chicken has mushrooms go "then get that one" Didn't seem like she wanted to give us her thoughts on the menu even though she was more than happy to give her menu thoughts to the table of 6 sitting beside us.  

Thirdly, don't send out a bus boy to ask us how our meals were.  I thought that was truly bad service.  What, you can't come by our table to ask us waitress?  

Other than the service, which is a major thing with me, the food was all right.  I had the chicken, like I said up there, and it was pretty good.  Although it was a lil rare near the bone, but what's a lil chicken blood gonna do to me right?   Not like I haven't gotten food poisioning before. 

So the gist of the 3 stars comes because of the service.  And that's the reason why I hope to bump up this rating the next time I feel like going to Perbacco.

excerpts: while it's no Acquerello, Perbacco has taken its place as one of the classier Italian joints in town.
perbacco.author: Andrew E.
perbacco.review:
Ate dinner with some friends here 2 weeks ago, and while it is still a little rough around the edges, I was impressed.  What used to be the Gold Coast has been given a thoroughly modern (and likely expensive) update... and while it's no Acquerello, Perbacco has taken its place as one of the classier Italian joints in town.  

The menu: a good selection of crudo and cured meats to share, a variety of pastas and risottos (I had the Tajarin with Pork Sugo, which was a perfect hearty winter dish) and several savory meaty mains.  We were too full for dessert, so I can't comment.  As you'd expect, the wine list is heavily Italian; plenty of interesting selections that  are fairly priced.  I'm definitely looking forward to a few more meals here... For those of you who work in the financial district with a decent-sized lunch budget, (or, if you can eat on the company's dime), you owe it o yourselves to give it a shot.

excerpts: Perbacco is a easy, loud and impressive Italian restaurant in the Financial District.
Nice bar scene and easy for diners eating alone.
perbacco.author: Laurence H.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is a easy, loud and impressive Italian restaurant in the Financial District.  Nice bar scene and easy for diners eating alone.  The service is very competent but fair warning that the portions are small making it a high $/lbs. meal.

Still, it is a place to be scene and to have truly authentic Italian cuisine.  They have a great wine list as well as a nice selection of cold cuts for appetizers.

excerpts:
It's also exactly why I go to restaurants like Perbacco on weeknights.

After spending twelve hours in front of a computer, I'm in desperate need for some face time and a wee bit of culinary pampering, so I pinged a co-worker and made reservations for Perbacco on Wednesday night.
perbacco.author: Carla C.
perbacco.review:
I work in Silicon Valley, which translates to 2 hour commutes to the city and not having much of a chic life during the work week. It's also exactly why I go to restaurants like Perbacco on weeknights.

After spending twelve hours in front of a computer, I'm in desperate need for some face time and a wee bit of culinary pampering, so I pinged a co-worker and made reservations for Perbacco on Wednesday night.

It was my second time at the restaurant, and I'm still in love with the sleek and classy decor, and the great front of house staff. We were seated on time for our 8:30 PM reservation, and started off with delicious cocktails (a friend had a Manhattan, and myself a Hendrick's and tonic). 

The server walked the perfect line between being polite and being excited about the menu, and we ended up with a bottle of white from Liguria, split a lovely pear and arugula salad, risotto with quail, and herb gnocchi - all of which were delectable. 

However, dessert knocked my little cotton socks off. We split the gelato trio, and let me tell you, the caramel with black sea salt sprinkled on top was better than my last three dates. Honest. 

Moral of the story is that it's an impressive space with great food - don't miss it.

excerpts: I had heard differing reports on Perbacco since it opened, but I finally made it down there a little while back for lunch.
I thought everything was awesome.
My squid app was so good and the portion was pretty generous for fresh squid.
I also ordered the paparadelle with duck ragu.
Holy hell, that shit was good.
And there were mounds of duck.
HEAPS of duck.
And it wasn't fatty duck either, just tender morsels.
Jesus.
perbacco.author: Katie M.
perbacco.review:
I had heard differing reports on Perbacco since it opened, but I finally made it down there a little while back for lunch.  I thought everything was awesome.  My squid app was so good and the portion was pretty generous for fresh squid.  I also ordered the paparadelle with duck ragu.  Holy hell, that shit was good.  And there were mounds of duck.  HEAPS of duck.  And it wasn't fatty duck either, just tender morsels.  Jesus.  I almost ate every bite, which is rare for me.  

Fuck, now I am craving duck.  This isn't good.....

excerpts: Perbacco has gone above and beyond.
Their selection of food was wonderful and the service was great.
We all had different things from the menu and lord knows I should remember what we ate
but my gut is so full that I forgot.
Oh wait
, I do remember I had the beef short ribs because the meat was so tender that it kept slipping from my fork.
But that is all I can remember.
So, Perbacco receives a 5 stars from me and I will definitely keep coming back.
perbacco.author: Kathy T.
perbacco.review:
Finally!!!! I have been dreaming to eat at this place. I've read the reviews and harped on my friends to eat here. Will today was it. It's my birthday today and they took me here for my surprise birthday luncheon. 
Perbacco has gone above and beyond. Their selection of food was wonderful and the service was great. We all had different things from the menu and lord knows I should remember what we ate but my gut is so full that I forgot. Oh wait, I do remember I had the beef short ribs because the meat was so tender that it kept slipping from my fork. But that is all I can remember. I do know that the food was delicious and that we were happy campers. 

So, Perbacco receives a 5 stars from me and I will definitely keep coming back.

excerpts: But if you're into fancy sandwiches and meat and cheese, then give Perbacco a try.
perbacco.author: Daniel L.
perbacco.review:
Service excellent, meal good, price expensive, ambiance upscale.

From the moment we walked in, the service here superb; from the hostess to our server to who seemed like the manager or owner. We started out with the piastra seared local squid which was just so-so.  It was extremely tender, but it had an awkward smell to it that I really didn't like.  I had the hanger steak as the main dish, and other than it being a little chewy it was excellent. I'm usually picky when it comes to seasoning (especially if it's too salty), but the seasoning was just right and the side of potatoes was delicious. The portion looked very small at first, but it was surprisingly filling for a lunch serving. 

My firm has also held happy hours here where I found the service to be consistently excellent.  They don't actually have a "happy hour", so don't go there expecting discounted drinks though.  The appetizers were a bit too fancy shmancy for me, and I would've rather preferred fries and onion rings.  But if you're into fancy sandwiches and meat and cheese, then give Perbacco a try.

excerpts: Good work Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Dave R.
perbacco.review: The food was top shelf, the wine list was robust, and the service never missed a beat, all this during a pack to the rafters night. We actually were in the upstairs table..... the fois grous appetizer was great, I can't wait to go another round here. Good work Perbacco.

excerpts: Would Perbacco hobnob with the aforementioned heavyweights?
Perbacco exudes a brasserie ethos, interested more in turning tables rather than allowing diners to patiently peregrinate through a meal.
I appreciate that Perbacco makes these sausages in house.
I would have appreciated them even more if they tasted good.
Seriously, did the kitchen think I hungered for a coprophagy experience?
perbacco.author: Andrew F.
perbacco.review:
Ah, the ever so affluent Financial District houses some of San Francisco's finest restaurants - One Market, Boulevard, Aqua. Would Perbacco hobnob with the aforementioned heavyweights? 

As the host ushered me to a table, she asked if I had ever dined here before. I told her I had not, but mentioned that I had eaten at neighboring Aqua not long ago. This is not like Aqua, she said. Ever so right she was. 

Perbacco exudes a brasserie ethos, interested more in turning tables rather than allowing diners to patiently peregrinate through a meal. 

Before commenting on the food, I ought to describe the interior. A long, narrow path runs from the entrance through to the kitchen with seating areas bordering on both sides. When dinner service starts and men and women strut through the dining room, it looks as if an incondite fashion show is taking place.

First, I ordered the pork liver with gherkins and grain mustard, which just so happened to be my favorite dish tonight, for it reminded me of childhood lunches at home with libamáj spread liberally on sandwiches.

I ordered to small pastas - the herb ricotta gnocchi and herb agnolotti - that were delivered on the same plate. Neither was that memorable. 

For my main, I ordered the sausage assortment. I appreciate that Perbacco makes these sausages in house. I would have appreciated them even more if they tasted good. Seriously, did the kitchen think I hungered for a coprophagy experience? The blood sausage was cloying; the "crispy pancetta," as stated on the menu, was gelatinous. 

I opted to forgo pudding dessert, but the server still brought four bite size chocolates.

excerpts: Perbacco is just around the corner from my office
and it's a shame
I've only been there once because it is absolutely amazing.
I went for a team lunch and had a 12:30 reservation for a table of 7.
We only waited a few minutes before being seated... thumbs up.
perbacco.author: Han C.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is just around the corner from my office and it's a shame I've only been there once because it is absolutely amazing.  I went for a team lunch and had a 12:30 reservation for a table of 7. We only waited a few minutes before being seated... thumbs up.  The service through out the lunch was very good, as well.

We shared several delicious appetizers, but the one that stays in mind is the salumi misti.  It has the most amazing pate! My pappardelle for entree was excellent.

The lunch prices aren't half bad - and I'm definitely coming back!

excerpts: Perbacco is near perfection.
The atmosphere is chic, the food is AMAZING (and reasonably priced), and the service is even more amazing!
perbacco.author: Jamie C.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is near perfection. The atmosphere is chic, the food is AMAZING (and reasonably priced), and the service is even more amazing! Our waitress was so helpful and full of suggestions, and every person in the restaurant serves with a smile. 

I wanted to order the papardelle, but the waitress talked me into the fettuce, and she didn't steer me in the wrong direction. It was SOOOO good! I also recommend the pear, endive, and gorgonzola salad - yum! Finally, you must try one of the desserts. I was full and saying no, but we decided to share one for the table, and the pistacchio cake was beyond delicious!

Great great restaurant!

excerpts: Perbacco did a really good job!
Reserved us a nice round table upstairs and wrote my sister a cute birthday card!
What a nice touch!
perbacco.author: J T.
perbacco.review:
Been here enough time... for business & for pleasure.

The price point for the quality of food is worth it.

It's loud downstairs, but ask to be seated upstairs. it's quieter and the ambiance is a bit different.

Took sis here for her bday with the fam. Perbacco did a really good job! Reserved us a nice round table upstairs and wrote my sister a cute birthday card! What a nice touch! Oustanding service.

LOVE, love, love it!

P.S. the steak is HUGE. Pappardelle is REALLY good. I'm not lying. Get it. I'm serious! Please also don't skip out on dessert. Get the warm hazelnut cake and tell me how you liked it. :)

excerpts:
Dear, Perbacco: 

I love you.
perbacco.author: Veronica Y.
perbacco.review:
Dear, Perbacco: 

I love you.  You made my 30th birthday (er ... whatever bday it might have truly been) super special.  Number 1, you seated me and my husband in a private corner, away from the kitchen and bathroom.  Number 2, you wrote me a personal card - how f'ing sweet!.  Number 3, hello, awesome food! The crudo and pastas are to DIE for - so good that I ordered 2 dinners! Number 4, you gave me a super special dessert that said "feliz cumpleanos" - mwah! That's a kiss from me to you - excellent service, amazing food.  Great upscale date place.

excerpts: With great food, service and cocktails Perbacco is the perfect place to start off any evening.
perbacco.author: Christopher H.
perbacco.review:
I read an article many years ago extolling the virtues of Manhattans served in San Francisco. I decided I had to see for myself. The first place I stopped on my exploration of Manhattans in San Francisco was Pebacco. Pebacco is in the middle of the Financial District, with a rather small facade that belies the size of the restaurant inside. I of course situated myself at the bar and, after introducing myself to the bartender, mentioned that I heard they do a great Manhattan. With pride he replied, "We absolutely do", and he put one together for me. The Manhattan was very good; it was well assembled, but it didn't have quite the level of bite I was looking for. The best way to describe their Manhattan is it's one with training wheels; if you're new to classic cocktails and are just looking for somewhere to start, this would be the Manhattan for you. It was mellow, approachable, but still tasty.

For dinner I decided to start off with the pesce crudo. Frankly, I had no idea what it would be, but the ingredients included hamachi, basil, ginger and a little jalapeño, which all sounded good and I took a chance and went for it. I'm glad I did. The flavors all came together perfectly, and the jalapeños were sliced thin enough that they brought just a little heat to the party but didn't overwhelm the dish. I went with the scallops for my main, which was served with corn and pearl onions. Scallops, like shrimp, are very simple to do well, but also very easy to overcook. I'd say that a good 80% of the time when I order either one in a restaurant it's rubbery and overcooked. These, however, were cooked to perfection. The wine the bartender recommended (a sauvignon blanc) matched nicely. With great food, service and cocktails Perbacco is the perfect place to start off any evening.

excerpts: Perbacco really is exceptional, authentic Piedmontese from the moment you sit down (bread sticks and pesto, rather than bread to start).
Service at Perbacco was also a head above the rest; we arrived early, and were seated prior to our actual reservation.
As we are rather young, my girlfriend and I are rather used to being ignored at restaurants; not the case here.
All told, Perbacco was a great experience, and one I would readily repeat.
perbacco.author: Patrick S.
perbacco.review:
I'm wavering between four and five stars on this one...this is the time I really wish Yelp would do fractions... 

Perbacco really is exceptional, authentic Piedmontese from the moment you sit down (bread sticks and pesto, rather than bread to start). I went two weeks ago with my girlfriend, and without fail the food was delicious. 

I started with truffle and ricotta gnocchi, mixed with wild mushrooms; the pasta was cooked wonderfully, and the flavors were very well balanced, with a distinct truffle note but not allowing either fungus to overpower the dish. She started with fritto misto rock shrimp, served with a lemon aioli; the shrimp was cooked very well, but to me the real standout here were the other bits in the dish. Green beans and a squash or cucumber were present, but the real surprise and delight was the occasional olive, prepared fritto misto as well. 

Our main courses continued this theme of excellence. Her pesto was some of the best I have ever tasted, striking a perfect balance between the powerful ingredients. I ordered the quail, which was presented steaming hot from its original dish onto my plate. The bird was stuffed with a sausage, which helped to balance with the gamy flesh, with beet greens and "polenta rustica", a coarse-grained polenta, on the side. Each of these was incredible, but the real finishing touch was black truffle grated over the polenta. That this was not advertised as part of the dish impressed me all the more. 

Between our dinners and the free bread and bread sticks, my date and I almost had to skip dessert, but we managed to eat our way through a raspberry sorbetto and strawberry gelato; that each of these tasted as if we were eating the chilled berries helped us in our endeavor. 

Service at Perbacco was also a head above the rest; we arrived early, and were seated prior to our actual reservation. As we are rather young, my girlfriend and I are rather used to being ignored at restaurants; not the case here. Our waiters were attentive and professional throughout the evening, and we never were wanting for service. 

All told, Perbacco was a great experience, and one I would readily repeat.

excerpts: Perbacco is a polished dining experience.
The restaurant is clean and sleek; all of the details appear to have been well thought out.
Perbacco is a solid spot for a business meal or for a meal with a large group of people.
perbacco.author: Adam L.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is a polished dining experience. The restaurant is clean and sleek; all of the details appear to have been well thought out. The wine list should be noted for breadth and quality.  

The food isn't memorable sans the enticing caramel gelato with sea salt. There isn't a single tasting plate, appetizer, pasta or main that lingers in my mind as being exceptional from visits in 2007 and 2008. That said, the truffle herb ricotta gnocchi and the seafood risotto are both solid dishes that are prepared well. 

Perbacco is a solid spot for a business meal or for a meal with a large group of people.

excerpts: I was very happy to see that Perbacco made it on the Top 100 Restaurants list of 2007!
perbacco.author: boots b.
perbacco.review:
I was very happy to see that Perbacco made it on the Top 100 Restaurants list of 2007! :)

I love how they totally transformed this space which was formally known as the Gold Coast (I never liked the Gold Coast, it was always really dark and crowded inside and having worked in the same building a few floors up, I hated the smell of cigars wafting up into our office at 3pm on the dot everyday - yuck!)

Lunch Menu

APPETIZERS
Brandacujun - salt cod and potato gratin is pretty good.  A little on the salty side but not bad.

Fritto Misto Rock Shrimp - delicious morsels of lightly breaded and fried shrimp and when dipped in the lemon ailoi it's even better.

Roasted Beets - goes really nicely with the white balsamic vinaigrette.

Squid with chili pepper and meyer lemon - I like all 3 of these ingredients but for some reason I didn't like this dish.

PASTAS
Butternut Squash - with crispy sage, brown butter and castelmagno cheese is heavenly.  The filling is so buttery, creamy and the pasta is perfectly tender - yum!

Tajarin - 5 hour pork sugo is pretty good.  It melts in your mouth and has a rustic Italian taste to it.

MAIN COURSES
Petrale Sole -  had a light crust of semolina and was nice and tender.

Pork Shoulder Al Latte - was absolutely delicious!  Al Latte means that the meat is braised in milk - sounds weird but it definitely worked!

DESSERTS
Panna Cotta flavored with Pistachio (they have a seasonal menu so I'm not sure if they still have this particular flavor) - I'm not a big fan of panna cotta in general,  but the waiter said it was his absolute favorite so I gave it a try.  I was VERY happy with it!  Smooth, silky and crunchy bits of pistachio...awesome!

Meyer Lemon Semifreddo - pretty good espcecially if you like REALLY tart desserts.

I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: Perbacco is the name that always comes up when Fin District folks talk about after work drinks/meals.
I went there with an open mind and was not disappointed.
Their decor is simple yet elegant and unobtrusive.
I went right after work and dimmed lights were a very pleasant change from the office lighting.
Perbacco offers a good selection, but our waiter wasn't very savvy when it came to talking about wine.
He basically read the menu to us and was very awkward with answering questions.
perbacco.author: Sophia G.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is the name that always comes up when Fin District folks talk about after work drinks/meals.  I went there with an open mind and was not disappointed. Their decor is simple yet elegant and unobtrusive. I went right after work and dimmed lights were a very pleasant change from the office lighting. I liked that this place was quiet enough to have a conversation without having to raise our voices.

I love meat of all kinds, so the salami sampler plate was a sheer delight. The meats were fresh and arranged beautifully. One plate was plenty for 2 people. 

The only downside to this experience was wine tasting. Perbacco offers a good selection, but our waiter wasn't very savvy when it came to talking about wine. He basically read the menu to us and was very awkward with answering questions. He was really pleasant, but maybe new to the job. 

Overall the place is a nice find, nothing to be super thrilled about, but a good spot to catch up with friends after work.

excerpts: The stellar service at Perbacco, prompt seating and beyond helpful attitude of the front desk just made the evening that much more enjoyable.
perbacco.author: Mary Ann K.
perbacco.review:
What a novel idea, solid service AND great food.  The stellar service at Perbacco, prompt seating and beyond helpful attitude of the front desk just made the evening that much more enjoyable.

We happened upon the restaurant since Tadich was overflowing with it's usual over-eager crowd.  We didn't have reservations but they were still accomodating and suggested that we could sit near the front, a more than adequate enough area to dine.  We were seated in 15 minutes, unheard of without reservations at most restaurants.

As for the menu, the food, the ambiance:

The in-house cured salami was amazing.  The waitress knew, extensively, everything about everything on the menu.  I asked if they cured the salami with sodium nitrate and she knew the answer right off the bat.  The heirloom salad was fresh and scrumptious.  The rest of the meal, including the rib, was perfectly cooked.  

The hazelnut cake and ugly cookies will be revisited, most definitely.  The menu beckons you to try everything.

The ambiance was excellent, having a great vibe, bustling with activity rather than frenetic pace.

A new fave in the city.

excerpts: On good advice we requested to be seated upstairs, Perbacco is BIG and downstairs is outright LOUD.
Perbacco is a fun place with darn good food, it is loud, it is expensive, its downtown.
perbacco.author: John D.
perbacco.review:
Decided to go for a nice leisurely meal with the wife before seeing Flight of the Conchords so read my review...if your into it.

On good advice we requested to be seated upstairs, Perbacco is BIG and downstairs is outright LOUD. If you want to hear others at your table sit upstairs, if you having drinks and apps sit downstairs.

We started with the Salumi selection which we both enjoyed esp. the fruit compote with pate'. Great salumi but not enough.

I started with a Gnocchi with wild mushrooms that wasn't on the menu but that our waiter said was fantastic...it was ask for it. My girl had papparadelle with duck ragu, she wouldn't let me have a bite so it had to be good.

We were going to split an entree but once we saw the menu we decided to go all out and get our own. I had the John Dory which was absolutely perfect, crispy and just tasty. As noted here previously though it had a bit much butter.....it didn't need it.

#1 wifey had the short rib over polenta. Again I didn't get a bite I think she growled at me when my fork strayed to her plate. She thought the polenta was undercooked as it had a bit of tooth to it.

Service was fantastic, really surprising for a place of this size. Attentive without being intrusive.

Pistachio Gelato and Carmel something or other were really good desserts. They also have excellent dark roast very Italian style coffee.

The only real disappointment was the wine. I asked the sommelier to recommend a lighter italian red. I know CA andf FRA wine pretty darn well but just have never gotten a full grasp on Italian reds so I trusted her. Big disappointment we ended up with a very Tannic 'y bottle that didnt match our description of what we liked.

Perbacco is a fun place with darn good food, it is loud, it is expensive, its downtown. If you want an intimate neighborhood experience go elsewhere.

Ciao!

excerpts:
Overall, Perbacco delivers nicely in every category:
1) Relaxed ambiance with soft-lighting and high ceilings.
Good food all around.

The highlights for us were: the house-cured meat appetizer plate (ask the servers for wine pairing recommendations) which was fantastic and the agnolotti with rabbit and truffle was rich and not gamey.
The rib-eye with gorgonzola butter was tender and flavorful.
The service was very friendly and attentive.
There was someone who was probably the manager floating around and was quite knowledgeable about their wine list.
perbacco.author: Rick T.
perbacco.review:
Business-casual restaurant that is too noisy for a romantic dinner, but the setting is nice for small groups.  If you want a quieter table, try the upstairs dining area.  They are not pretentious nor over-hyped.  Overall, Perbacco delivers nicely in every category:
1) Relaxed ambiance with soft-lighting and high ceilings.
2) Good food all around.  The highlights for us were: the house-cured meat appetizer plate (ask the servers for wine pairing recommendations) which was fantastic and the agnolotti with rabbit and truffle was rich and not gamey.   The rib-eye with gorgonzola butter was tender and flavorful.
3) The service was very friendly and attentive.  There was someone who was probably the manager floating around and was quite knowledgeable about their wine list.  She was not a sommelier but made great recommendations for pairing each part of our meal.

I look forward to our next dining experience here.

Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly, even though we brought our own bottle of wine (cutting into our bill, his tip). excerpts: My boss and I went to Perbacco for lunch yesterday.
perbacco.author: Earline A.
perbacco.review:
My boss and I went to Perbacco for lunch yesterday.  We'd both been looking forward to it, and it lived up to our expectations.

They started us out with both breadsticks, coupled with a nice, fresh pesto, AND bread and butter.  We shared all of the dishes.  We started off with the pear/arugula/gorgonzola/hazelnut salad (smallish, but really good) and the papardelle with short rib ragu.  The papardelle dish was so good we were fighting over the serving plate to lick it.  It struck the perfect balance between being really satisfying comfort food and not being too heavy.  Flavors were blended perfectly and textures were great.  The fresh pasta was superb.

Our entrees were braised pork shoulder over savoy cabbage for her, and grilled chicken for me.  The pork, as with the beef in the appetizer, was fall-apart yummy, but not too heavy.  I would give a lot to have that dish again on a cold, rainy day.  It came with polenta, the perfect accompaniment.  My grilled chicken breast was the best I've ever had.  My boss agreed.  It was fresh and moist, grilled perfectly, with a lovely sauce.

Finally, dessert--the reason we wanted to try this restaurant:  a trio of gelati, all of which were quite good, but the highlight was the caramel gelato with chunks of sea salt blended in.  The combination of textures and sweet/salty flavors was practically orgasmic.

The service was pleasant and efficient.  Although it was crowded, it was not so loud that we could not converse.  I can't think of a thing about this place I would change.  I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: Perbacco can certainly stand up on its own against the heavyweights around the financial district area.

perbacco.review:
Amazing new restaurant.  Ambiance & service is top notch.  The place was packed. 

I honestly didn't care for the fried shrimp appetizer or my dinner which was a Butternut squash pasta plate (I'm pescatarian, but I had enough seafood in SF for a couple of days), but my associates certainly enjoyed their other options of beef.  I do have to comment their dessert was to die for.  Incredible food.  I really enjoyed it.  I certainly would love to come back and try their other entrees. 

Perbacco can certainly stand up on its own against the heavyweights around the financial district area.

excerpts: I am updating my review of Perbacco.
Our second visit to Perbacco was a totally different and far better experience.
Overall, our second visit to Perbacco was completely different  in terms of food, service and ambiance.
I feel that this was a truer experience of Perbacco and that it does live up to its reputation.
I had a great time and will be back.
perbacco.author: Brett H.
perbacco.review:
I am updating my review of Perbacco. 

After my initial review, where I gave the restaurant 2 stars, I received a letter of apology from them which came a a pleasant surprise. I have never had such a thing happen to me and as a result my boyfriend and I decided to give them another try.

Our second visit to Perbacco was a totally different and far better experience.

When we got there we were seated within a couple of minutes at a nice table on the ground floor.  The area we were in was fairly quiet and my boyfriend and I could have a pleasant conversation.  We had a great server, who spent time explaining several of the items on the menu and make very good wine pairing suggestions for the dishes we ordered.

The food:
I"ll start with my dishes.
House made salumi: Delicious.  Very fresh and for the first time I had  blood salami and it was really good.

Grilled Octopus with potatos and haricort vertes:  This was an amazing appetizer.  The octopus was so tender, it didn't even really seem like I was eating octopus. 

Tagliatelle with Pork Sugo and Porcini Mushrooms:  Again another winner.  Very savory and rich in flavor, the pasta and the pork/mushrom sauce were a great pairing.

I also asked my boyfriend to tell me how his dishes were and here are his comments.
Hamachi:  Excellent!   Unusual combination of flavors including mint lime and honeydew melon with the hamachi, which combined to create a dish that melted in the mouth.

Seared Sea Bass:  This was a delicious dish as well.  The fish was excellently seasoned and was a good portion size in that it wasn't too small.

Overall, our second visit to Perbacco was completely different  in terms of food, service and ambiance.  I feel that this was a truer experience of Perbacco and that it does live up to its reputation.  I had a great time and will be back.

excerpts: I had the pleasure of being "treated" to Perbacco today for lunch.
I've been looking for an excuse to try the place and someone finally offered to introduce me to the fantastic lunch menu.
perbacco.author: Steve J.
perbacco.review:
I had the pleasure of being "treated" to Perbacco today for lunch. I've been looking for an excuse to try the place and someone finally offered to introduce me to the fantastic lunch menu. The meal was satisfying, the portions generous and the service prompt and pleasant.

We sat in the main dining room and, contrary to other reviewers, my companion and I were perfectly able to carry on a conversation without shouting to be heard. Service was attentive without being bothersome and we were given all the time we needed to make our decisions. 

Food: very good, 4 stars. 

Here's the breakdown ...

Salads:

I enjoyed the beet salad, my companion loved her tomato salad (end of season, probably the last chance to indulge). We tasted from one another's plates and agreed both salads hit the mark - well balanced flavors, appropriate portion sizes, great textures. 

Pastas:

I had to try the pappardelle given the number of people I've spoken to who raved about it. I thought it was very good, but I kept thinking it needed something ... like salt. The flavors were complex, but they didn't blow me away and I just couldn't get enough of the taste of the sauce. However, the pasta itself was exceptional. I could have eaten it with just a little olive oil and salt and pepper and been just as happy. Still, not a bad dish and I recommend it to my pappardelle loving friends.

My companion enjoyed the agnolotti filled with veal and cabbage with a bit of the short rib ragu drizzled over the top. It looked great, but I didn't try it. I will next time!

Cheese:

We finished our lunch by sharing a 3-choice cheese plate. I ordered the gorgonzola dolce, the goat and the Brescianella All'Aquavite (a cow's milk cheese coated in rye husks and soaked in grappa). The portions were unbelievably generous. I'm accustomed to cheese slivers when I order a cheese course out. It was almost too much cheese (saying a lot for an addict like me). It came with a plate of sliced walnut bread, roasted almonds, honey and re-hydrated golden raisins. Perfection!

I'll go back for lunch, but I'd also like to try the dinner menu with a little wine.

Their wide range of pastas were great.  Try the pig head terrine if you are bold enough.  You may be pleasantly surprised.

Waiters are very attentive

Very hard to get a reservation at times especially on friday and saturday night. 

Plan ahead

but they also gave us a nice card and a special dessert presentation, which I thought was a nice example of going above and beyond, and why they deserve five stars.
The price provides good value for the food, the service is top notch and the ambience is fun enough for a group and still romantic for a couple.
Parking is probably a beast, they offer valet but we got a ride in and out.
Highly recommend for a special event.
perbacco.author: Christopher V.
perbacco.review:
My wife and I were super impressed with every aspect of the experience here. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. We made our reservation on opentable.com and when we arrived the hostess offered to seat us right away or to wait until 6:30 and have a drink in the bar. We tried the mojito and a house special with gin, cucumber infused syrup and lemon juice, both were superb. The servers were very friendly and professional. I asked to be seated in a quieter area (it's not overly loud inside but it's not super quite either) as it was our anniversary, and we were seated in a corner booth which was perfect. The server was helpful in her wine recommendations, as neither of us are familiar with Italian varietals. Wine also comes by the glass, 1/4 L or 1/2 L which is perfect for a couple. The mixed salumi plate was excellent but rich, it's probably a bit more than two people need but offers a nice variety of cured pork and veal. 

Dinner was the duck for me and meyer lemon/mint ravioli for the wife, both were excellent. The duck was cooked perfectly and melted in your mouth, and the ravioli were flavorful and tender. Dessert for me was the buttermilk panna cotta and the doughnuts for her, both excellent and the wife's doughnuts came in a cute little white takeout bag, I thought it was a nice touch. They offer dessert wine suggestions with the desserts which is helpful for those who enjoy dessert wines. They also offer a selection of digestifs and bourbon, brandy. The pacing of the meal was so nice, there was ample time in between courses to digest and the food came out at a proper temperature, ready to eat. I notified Perbacco that it was our anniversary mainly to get a quite table but they also gave us a nice card and a special dessert presentation, which I thought was a nice example of going above and beyond, and why they deserve five stars. The price provides good value for the food, the service is top notch and the ambience is fun enough for a group and still romantic for a couple. Parking is probably a beast, they offer valet but we got a ride in and out. Highly recommend for a special event.

excerpts: Now, granted I live in North Beach and am not really a fan of Italian food, but the dishes at Perbacco are light and fresh...not your heavy standard fare.
perbacco.author: Amy K.
perbacco.review:
This is my new favorite Italian restaurant in SF.  Now, granted I live in North Beach and am not really a fan of Italian food, but the dishes at Perbacco are light and fresh...not your heavy standard fare.

The interior is gorgeous; all interactions with the staff were great (friendly, genuine, and knowledgeable); and the food is wonderful.  

We started with the burrata cheese- so yummy!  (even if it did kick my lactose intolerant ass later in the night).  Then, we shared a half order of the pasta with short ribs which was also excellent.  The actual pasta was the best I've had in SF and the meat was not over-powering.  Finally, the duck- delicious and served with a lovely stone fruit salad with perfectly ripe and juicy cherries and nectarines.

We complimented all this yumminess with a bottle of primitivo (essentially the only Italian red varietal I know anything about) at the bargain basement price of $31.  The food only made the wine taste even better.

I'd definitely go back for drinks/snacks or dinner (love that it's like 3 blocks from my office so it makes a great weeknight choice). Highly recommend!

excerpts: One friend from out of town, another friend who recently moved to SF, my husband and I met up at Perbacco to have dinner on a Friday night.
perbacco.author: Jeannie L.
perbacco.review:
One friend from out of town, another friend who recently moved to SF, my husband and I met up at Perbacco to have dinner on a Friday night.  Although we had reservations, it took about 15 minutes to get seated and an uncomfortable 15 minutes at that because there was little room to stand and wait.

However, once we were seated, the service was great and the food and alcohol began to flow.  We shared the gnocchi, burrata and cured meats appetizers.  All were very tasty.  Us girls also started out with fragolinos (also very tasty) while my husband had beer.  We each ordered something different - the two fish dishes, the beef short rib and the duck breast.  The wine steward selected a light red wine that was delicious and accompanied everyone's dishes nicely.  The fish dishes were okay, the beef short rib a bit underseasoned and the duck breast sublime.  My friend (recent transplant from NYC) likes to pick a "winner" of the all the dishes that are ordered when we dine out.  The duck breast won easily.  

We also had desserts - sharing the pistachio cake, sorbetto and another litle cake (I can't remember what was in it except it was fruity).  The pistachio cake was my favorite - warm and crisp on the outside and gooey on the inside.  The sorbetto was delicious too - like taking a bite from a frozen strawberry.   The sorbetto came with two cookies.  I'd like to point out that my husband offered a cookie to my friend before offering it to me.

The rabbit sauce was excellent, but the rabbit itself seemed overcooked to me.  Our outstanding server paced the meal very well, kept our wine appropriately poured (we brought a bottle) and followed up to see how we were enjoying things.  When she asked about the rabbit, I simply told her that I loved the sauce but the meat was overcooked for me, she immediately asked if she could bring me a new serving.  I didn't want another dish because I was getting full.  So she insisted on bringing us dessert, which we reluctant accepted.  I forget was it was because we wolfed it down in two seconds, even though we were stuffed.

Had the rabbit been as perfect as everything else, this would be a 5 star review.  We'll definitely be back.

BTW - total bill was $150 (incl corkage, tax and tip).  Not bad for such superb service and wonderful food.  Plus, the gift cert covered most of the bill! :)

excerpts: I go to less expensive restaurants with better food, so will not be returning to Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Presto G.
perbacco.review: Food was good, service was good, ambiance was good. Good, not great. Especially for the price. The best thing, the breadsticks, were free! I go to less expensive restaurants with better food, so will not be returning to Perbacco.

excerpts: Today was my first time at Perbacco and fell in love.
Can't wait to go back again, definitely want to try dinner here as well!
For lunch I had the Tajarin (5 hour pork sugo with fresh handmade pasta)
it was amazing!
It came surprisingly fast - you can definitely have lunch here in 1 hour!
Excellent espresso as well.
Service - just as other reviewers have noted was impeccable.

excerpts: Perbacco is Perlicious!!
That is my new word for delicious food at Perbacco!
My husband and I went here for dinner to celebrate
so we went all out-
perbacco.author: Sonal B.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco is Perlicious!! That is my new word for delicious food at Perbacco! My husband and I went here for dinner to celebrate so we went all out- we had the following:

Plate of assorted salami- by no means run of the mill
Homemade stuffed ricotta gnocchi w/ melted cherry tomatoes
Homemade pesto tagliatelle w/ summer squash and potatoes
Grilled sardines on grilled salted watermelon
Grilled lamb
A lovely peach topped ricotta cake, with warm berry compote and peach caramel gelato
2 types of wine- you can get 1/4, 1/2 or 3/4 carafes so that you can sample different types

All of it was fantastic, and we felt like we got a lot for what we paid considering it was a fine dining establishment ($175 including tip and tax). It was a memorable meal, and we were lucky to have a really great server. The only downside to this place is that it is in the financial district so you have to deal w/ patrons whom you would likely never associate yourself with, if you are anything like us (our stomping grounds are the Mission District). 

Enjoy if you choose to go!

excerpts: Perbacco used to be good years ago.
perbacco.author: Jonathan H.
perbacco.review:
Perbacco used to be good years ago.  However, the operative description today is bland. 

First, we were early for our table but were left cooling our heels in the bar for 10 minutes past our reservation.

Second, the bathrooms were not clean with dirty toilet seats and sticky floors.  This was a bad sign for the overall managment.

The rolls were slightly stale and quite bland.

We got the nduja which was supposed to be spicy but only mildly so.  The crostini had no interesting seasoning on them.

The fritto misto with rock shrimp literally had 5 tiny shrimp on it and was packed with deep fried olives.  A few olives would have been nice but there were at least a dozen.  The poor shrimp were outnumbered.

The pasta with pork ragu was bland.  The pasta was overcooked in water that had no salt in it.  The ragu had little depth of flavor.

The short ribs were bland, no depth of flavor.  No herbal taste or complexity.  Also a bit greasy.

Did not stay for dessert.  

If I were you, I would hop next door to Tadich Grill, get a martini or manhattan, a nice shrimp cocktail, and a plate of pan-fried fish and you will spend less money and have a much better meal.

excerpts: PERBACCO delivers.
The food is TRULY excellent.
Their meat sauces are cooked for hours and if you think that doesn't make a difference, you haven't eaten at Perbacco yet.
perbacco.author: L M.
perbacco.review:
An exceptionally good restaurant. One caveat -- I don't find it romantic,.  It's nice, but if you're looking for hearts and flowers stuff -- this may not be your place. 

PERBACCO delivers.  The food is TRULY excellent.  Their meat sauces are cooked for hours and if you think that doesn't make a difference, you haven't eaten at Perbacco yet.  

I'm from SF -- grew up here -- so I'm used to good food, though I am not a "foodie."  And I'm not wealthy and there is a lot of very good food in S.F. that is not at "expense account" prices -- so I really expect good food and good service if I'm going to spend the big money  -- esp. since I am not "On expense account." 



I find the decor a bit uncomfortable and not as warm as I'd like it to be - but the restaurant is run incredibly well, the staff are top notch, the owner runs a tight ship and -- usually great bar staff, too.  they had TERRIFIC bar staff a couple of years ago -- very welcoming yet professional (it's a big power business spot), and they had memories -- go in there once and they'd recall what you drank.  that justified the high drink prices to me.  Then they had a guy who was a total dick who had worked at some high profile bars and therefore thought he was a "star" - and acted like it.  Apparently that was his "schtick" -- but not mine. In fact, I didn't go in for a year because the "attitude" was infuriating.  Went back in about 3 months ago, had a drink at the bar which is a bit of a twist on a common drink.  Lovely women bartender I'd never met before.  I came in a MONTH later, sat down, was talking with a friend before ordering and...my drink, perfectly made  (it's an easy drink, but you'd be amazed how many people really mess it up...)  set down in front of me before I had even said a word and she smiled and said "I'm taking a chance that this might be what you want..."

THAT, my friends, is worth $10 -- and a tip!

excerpts: Perbacco is good, but fails to blow me away.
It's a bit crowded and very loud, but doesn't disappoint.
I think, in many ways, it tries too hard, but it's well worth a return visit.
perbacco.author: David G.
perbacco.review: Perbacco is good, but fails to blow me away.  It's a bit crowded and very loud, but doesn't disappoint.  I think, in many ways, it tries too hard, but it's well worth a return visit.

excerpts: The service was exceptional from our first greeting by the hostess, to our server from Italy and our charming busser, the GM, the bartenders--essentially everyone who works at Perbacco was concerned with our comfort (and we were high-maintenance: cold, then hot, then cold).
perbacco.author: Basa P.
perbacco.review:
From the moment we walked in at 8 pm with the audacity of thinking we could get a table we were treated like queens. We were fortunate to slip in between turns and were seated immediately in a comfortable booth near the bar. The service was exceptional from our first greeting by the hostess, to our server from Italy and our charming busser, the GM, the bartenders--essentially everyone who works at Perbacco was concerned with our comfort (and we were high-maintenance: cold, then hot, then cold).

Then there was the food. We had four courses beginning with the Frito Misti with olives, the freshly made paparadelle in a short rib sugo, to the liberty duck breast with pears and finally the most amazing homemade gelato with fennel and caramel next to a perfect tartitine, followed by a great machiatto and (I didn't think I'd have room) balanced, crispy yet soft, house-baked biscotti. We had one of our best dates ever and we can't wait to go back. Go!  Go now.

excerpts: I try to only rate businesses that I absolutely love, and I do love Perbacco.
perbacco.author: Carla Y.
perbacco.review:
I try to only rate businesses that I absolutely love, and I do love Perbacco. 

Everything about it is great, and I've eaten here quite a number of times. The ambiance, the food, and service are fantastic. 

-1 star for our one and only shaky experience at the bar.  My recommendation to the barmen & sommalier: Don't assume we don't know what we're talking about simply because we're young or look young.    That's all.

excerpts: My parents hosted at Perbacco our wedding rehearsal dinner for 40 people.
They put our group in a intimate yet spacious private room, setup a separate bar so that guests did not have to walk
perbacco.author: Masa S.
perbacco.review:
My parents hosted at Perbacco our wedding rehearsal dinner for 40 people.  They put our group in a intimate yet spacious private room, setup a separate bar so that guests did not have to walk/wait for drinks, and provided great service for our large group.  

The food was even better than the outstanding service!  Everything tasted fresh and cooked-to-order, rather than tasting like "banquet" food.  In addition, the vegetarian dishes were OUTSTANDING!  One of my groomsmen is a Hindu vegetarian, and I was so relieved when they brought him dishes on par with the carnivore meals.  I was also glad that he was at my table so that I could steal tastes of his food.  

All in all, I would host a dinner here in a heartbeat, and my wife and I and all of our friends are buzzing about the need to go back for dinner.

excerpts:
Then through a maze of miscommunication, bad weather, missed trips, cancelled reservations and general discombobulation, we ended up at Perbacco for San Francisco/Seattle Seester Christmas Fest 2006.

These days, it seems that restaurants present amazing appetizers and then fall short on the entrees but Perbacco dishes up some amazing entrees.
perbacco.author: Lainie L.
perbacco.review:
"I want to take you out to dinner for your Christmas present." sez my seester.

"Okay, I'd like to go to Myth."  sez me.

"Really, Myth?  Are you sure?  Myth, really?" asks my seester.

"Yeah."  Sez me.  

"Hmmph. . . just seems like a scene to me. . .I am surprised you picked it."  

Oh.  I am overwhelmed by indecision.  

"Okay then, how about Fleur de Lys?"  I ask.

So we settle on Fleur de Lys.  

Then through a maze of miscommunication, bad weather, missed trips, cancelled reservations and general discombobulation, we ended up at Perbacco for San Francisco/Seattle Seester Christmas Fest 2006.

I like the design as you first walk in . .. it's welcoming and spacious.  The salumi plates are plated at one end of the bar and they have a kick ass chef's dream Italian meat slicer at the end of the bar - I was pleased as I took this as a sign of the restaurants seriousness about their food.  It was a good omen.

The next good omen was that the bartender had a lovely Irish accent . .. one from Cork I believe and it's one of my favorite accents ever.  He was darling and made us two very delicious drinks. . . as we waited for our table (we were early for our reservation) I perused the menu.  It all looked amazing!  It's one of those menus that makes you wish you had more than one stomach. . .sort of a reserve, if you will, for those times where you just don't want to be limited to one.  Like a ruminate but better.   I mentally made my choices and hoped my seester was hungry!

Next good omen is when we were shown to our table;  I like that altho we were only a deuce, they sat us at a four top.   I do truly appreciate some elbow room!

We ordered the ciccioli from the salumi menu which is a pork pate of sorts very similar to rilletes.  It was delicious - it came with some crostini and a small dollop of orange marmalade to offset the richness.  

Next came the burrata.  A very generous mound of unctuous cheese drizzled with black truffle oil.  Served with perfectly toasted filone.  My only disappointment here was I would have like more bread with this dish.

Next came carne cruda - a steak tartare of sorts made with veal instead of beef (same but different) - very delicious with just the right amount of garlic to accent the veal without overwhelming it.  We also got the fritto misto which was good as well with the usual suspects (rock shrimp, green beans, fennel) and a surprise of olives. . I'd never had a deep fried olive before and really enjoyed it.  

Next came three appetizer portions of pasta - a pappardelle with braised shortrib sauce and porcini, penne with meatballs and tajarin; which is a thin, square cut pasta similar to angel hair with a five hour pork sugo.  Of the three, the best was the pappardelle - really deep flavor - almost buttery from the braise.  The tajarin was very good, too.  The pasta was obviously fresh and perfectly cooked and the sauce was quite delicious.   One complaint would be that it was that none of the pastas were hot enough - I think it would have been helpful to heat the plates and serve the pasta in small, shallow bowls as opposed to flat plates.   Also, the meatballs were a little tough - flavorful but tough. 

Next (no, I am not kidding!), came the pork shoulder, short ribs and a piece of cotechino  - cotechino is one of my favorite Italian sausages and they were featuring it in a bollito misto - I didn't want all the elements of a bollito misto so I asked for just a piece of the cotechino and they very graciously complied and even served it with the three sauces that would have gone with the bollito misto - an orange marmalade, a finely pureed salsa verde and a piquant tomato relish.  The pork shoulder was one of my best dishes I've ever had.  I love braised meat and this dish was just so perfect, I wanted to eat only that.  But then the short rib was not too shabby either. . it's kind of like if you had Jeffrey Dean Morgan standing next to George Clooney and you had to pick between them.  Both luscious!  The cotechino was stellar as well - perfect texture and very balanced spices.  I was so happy with the entrees!  These days, it seems that restaurants present amazing appetizers and then fall short on the entrees but Perbacco dishes up some amazing entrees.

We were full so we didn't get to have dessert - next time less entrees, more dessert.  

This restaurant is only 7 weeks old so there were some service bumps - kind of slow on service and lag time between pastas and entrees was a little long.  The clientele is a trip - there were a lot of really drunk people there - and while that is not the restaurants fault, it was kind of a distraction.  The bathrooms are funky.  Unisex but not. . .you'll go, you'll see.  

I can't wait for my seester to come visit again so we can again - next time, my treat!

excerpts: Went to Perbacco with my parents for a special meal and enjoyed everything I ate, but I was glad someone else was paying.
I had the seared scallops, but I tried everyone else's entrees, and thought mine was the winner.
We suspected that we were seated upstairs because we were dressed somewhat casually.
Everyone upstairs seemed a bit more casual than the people we peeked at through the glass ledge.
We weren't offended, but consider yourself warned--if you want to sit in the main dining room, cotton isn't going to cut it.

excerpts: Oh, and so you think I'm not sophisticated enough to appreciate the food, I do NOT think that Olive Garden is gourmet (although probably more worth the price than Perbacco)!
perbacco.author: Richard N.
perbacco.review: When I come across a restaurant with an average of 4 stars based on over 1000 reviews, I've got to believe that it's going to be a delight to eat there. Ok, so apparently there are 1000 people on Yelp who have not had truly good Italian food, I guess.  The restaurant was fine; had I come across it walking by and had a meal, I'd be ok with it. Presentation varied between delightful (beet salad) sloppy (agnolotti appetizer dumped on a plate).  The taste? Well, as ex-Californian (born and raised there), I can only say this ... It's like a stereotypical Hollywood blonde with surgical 'enhancements' that make her look like a cover girl ... You would do anything to date her based on appearance but when you sit down to talk, you realize that she is as vacuous as a blank canvas. The food was monotonous, at best. The ideas looked nice on paper but when the plate came to the table, "meh" is all I could think. My wife actually sent her dish back it was so bland.   My advice is to take what you read with a grain of salt; even my evaluation.  Just be cautious, that's all.  Oh, and so you think I'm not sophisticated enough to appreciate the food, I do NOT think that Olive Garden is gourmet (although probably more worth the price than Perbacco)!

excerpts: I've never been in an upscale restaurant - like Perbacco - where diners are so packed in at the bar; it's quite unpleasant.

I've never been in an upscale restaurant - like Perbacco - where diners are so packed in at the bar; it's quite unpleasant. This isn't a diner - or is it?
